114.title: A Fire Nation Prison

1141.content:
The world around you was one of darkness and close space. Four wooden walls enclosed your world, granting you a mere arm’s length of space. Not a sliver of light penetrated your pine prison as you sat uncomfortably upon the wooden floor; your knees tucked tightly into your chest as you fought the nausea raging through your belly.

It was the damned swaying. Back and forth your cage rocked, as if hung from a pendulum. You squeezed your knees tightly, fighting off the urge to retch as you listened to the soft, tapping noise which seemed to coincide ever so neatly with the motion of your prison.

You had awoken what felt like an eternity ago to find yourself in the hated, swaying prison, but it was far more likely to have been a mere hour. Upon regaining consciousness, a headache had greeted you, your head light and airy. Dully, you had tried to wrack your brain for any memory of where you were or how you had gotten here, but you drew a blank. In fact, you had realized that you couldn’t remember much about the previous day save the fire lord’s ascension to phoenix king and the announcement of a new fire lord.

Had it really been yesterday? Given the current state of your memory, you couldn’t be sure how long you had lain unconscious, but for some reason you were sure that it had only been one day. Some memories started to resurface, and you vaguely remembered someone important approaching you. However, who it had been eluded you. Instead, you just felt a deep thread of terror at the thought of that person.

A sudden boom resounded through your container as the bottom struck something solid. You covered your ears, your nausea almost overcoming you as the sudden noise split your skull. The sudden noise had startled you, alone in the dark, but more pressingly it had aggravated you headache. A sudden thought surged to the forefront of your mind.

“What if I got on the wrong side of someone important? What if I were being hauled away for punishment?” As panic started to grow within you, the wooden roof suddenly lifted away and light flooded your chamber, blinding you.

You spent the next minute huddled in a ball, waiting for your eyes to adjust to the ambient light now flooding your box. It wasn’t that the light was especially bright, it was the light of a low burning fire, but having grown so accustomed to the dark it still left you blinded. However, as time passed the world around you began to come into focus.

The first thing you noticed was the room. Given the limited view from the hole in the top of your chamber you couldn’t see much of it, but even half blinded it was easily the largest room you had ever seen. The roof hung more than a hundred feet over head, stretching endlessly without support or pillar until it met a wall. And the wall itself, It was a massive thing with a single decoration. A banner baring the fire nation symbol stretching as far as the gap above you allowed you to perceive. Somewhere out of sight a bonfire of immense size must be burning, for the room was lit from corner to corner by fire light. The room’s immense size was a thing of wonder, reminding you of exactly how small a thing you were in the eyes of the fire nation. It was at this banner that you gazed until your eyesight was fully restored.

“The view must be magnificent from where you’re standing.” The voice came as a low whisper, yet it was as loud as someone shouting. Its tone was cool, and the words slithered as they reached your ears. A chill ran up your spine and you nearly jumped out of your skin in your haste to stand up and turn around.

A sea of shadow filled your vision at you gazed at the shadowed form before you. A black cloth dropped down from a crimson sash, outlined by gold with a sea of red to either side. To either side, red pillars flanked your box, rising upwards in a cascade of the finest silk. You followed these pillars upwards, passed ornate frill and upwards towards the chest piece; a black piece of cloth lined with gold which fanned downwards into a point at the sternum and upwards to form pointed shoulder pads. The fire nation insignia was emblazoned upon it. Resting at its apex was a red and golden collar, but it was what sprouted from that collar which took your full attention.

Her neck was a thing of beauty. Sleek and slender, its porcelain surface sprouted from the rich red collar. Following its slender curve a chin soon appeared, small and delicate, soon followed by a pair of ruby red lips. A flash of white peeked through their supple passage, and you realized that they were parted in a smirk. Two smooth, pale cheeks flanked a elegant nose, and you followed the subtle curve upwards until you reached those eyes. Those cold, cold eyes.

Quickly, you took in the rest of the figure before you. Sharp eyebrows angled away, one raised in a wry gesture of amusement. Her jet black hair was pulled back in a neat bun, a sheet of obsidian flowing down her neck and framing her face. However, it was her eyes which kept drawing you back, icy portals that somehow oozed smug amusement.

It was then that you suddenly realized you perspective. You were staring up at the figure before you. Not up as one might look at someone standing on a balcony above you, but up as someone would look at a mountain. She was colossal. You felt your knees trembling as the sheer impossibility of the situation sank in.

You had to be dreaming, there was simply no other explanation. You brought your hand up in a harsh slap, trying to knock some sense back into yourself. However, as the ringing in your ears slowly faded the giant figure before you didn’t fade. You weren’t dreaming.

As you gazed up at the figure towering above, you realized that you weren’t just shaking from shock of seeing a giantess. No, it was the way she looked at you, her hands planted to either side of your box as leaned over your insignificant existence. She exuded an aura of power, of authority which threatened to choke you. You legs finally lost strength, and you found yourself sitting upon the floor.

“Now, do you remember why you’re here?” the cold whisper washed over you once more, filling you with dread. You were filled with the urge to yell that you didn’t remember anything, to get away, to escape the giant figure, but an itch started at the back of your mind. The itch grew stronger until it soon took hold of you. Suddenly, the previous day’s events came rushing back to you.
1141.title: Alone in the Dark*

11411.content:
You were standing guard in the royal palace, an insignificant post guarding an old cellar, when she came. Azula, her arms clasped behind her back as she boldly strolled down the hallway. She approached you alone, wearing the magnificent crimson robes, her hair bound in a bun. So caught off guard were you at the sudden approach with by the next fire lord that you nearly fell as you rushed to kneel. Even in this lowly bit of the palace, you had heard the news of her ascension.

It had barely been an hour since the phoenix king Ozai had ascended, leaving his daughter the title of fire lord and yet here she was. Something was up. Shouldn’t the next fire lord be off preparing for her ceremony, not wandering around in the bowels of the palace? However, it wasn’t your place to question. You remained kneeling, patiently waiting for princess Azula to pass. However, instead of walking past, she stopped; turning towards you as you knelt.

“Rise.” That one word carried such power, such authority. It was as if an invisible hand reached into your core and squeezed, forcing you to obey. You rose to your feet in a surprisingly steady motion, her command lending you confidence. You were spellbound as you stood up to your full height, your back straight and proud as you looked to your liege for commands.

However, as you stood there awaiting the command of the fire lord to be, the intimidating figure before you said nothing. Instead, she simply stared at you, eyeing your face as if you were some prized goat to be auctioned off. Her eyes chilled you. You had no doubt that as she looked at you; she wasn’t measuring a guard at his post, but instead was checking the quality of a tool; seeing whether or not you fit her need. To her, you were not a person.

The thoughts robbed you of your previous resolved, bringing out the nervous boy within you once more. You were only sixteen, having received this post at the pleading of your father, a lowly official of no import. You were a nobody. Why was the next fire lord so interested in you?

“You’ll do.” Her voice was cold and emotionless. A chill ran down your spine and you realized you were trembling. Azula was several inches shorter than you, two years younger than you, and probably fifty pounds lighter than you, but it didn’t matter. One look in her eyes filled you with an instinctual terror, like a mouse staring at a lion.

“M…My Lord?” Your voice trembled and broke. It was as pathetic a sight as you could ever imagine and it only made you feel more exposed. However, Azula only smiled.

“If only my brother were so timid. It would make things so much easier.”

You waited for more information, but Azula made no move to answer. Instead she only stared at you further, a sinister smile playing across her face. With a shock, you realized she was enjoying your discomfort. However, after a while she spoke once more, her voice a low rasp as she continued.

“As you know, I am to become the fire lord three days from now as Sozin’s Comet lights the sky. That leaves me two days to myself, for meditation usually but I have no need for such a thing. Instead, I’d like to spend the time with some… old friends of mine.” She let a pause hang in the air, almost daring you to break the silence. However, when you remained silent she continued.

“However, these dear friends of mine have done me a… disservice recently. A betrayal if you will. I was furious at the time, but now I’ve realized that they hold a very special place in my heart and I would be loathed to lose their companionship. In fact, the fault for their betrayal lies with myself really. I didn’t spend enough time reinforcing our relationship, reminding them of exactly what they were to me. Now, I’m seeking a way to reconcile our differences, and so that’s where you come in.” Her gaze narrowed, her golden eyes burning with a predatory light as they focused intently upon you. You tried your best to shrivel away, to draw into yourself and hide from the world, but her eyes pierced you. There was nowhere to hide.

“You see, our little disagreement was centered around a boy; my brother, whom you’ve no doubt heard plenty about. So, I wanted to surprise them by bringing Zuko with me to share the news of my rise to fire lord. However, little Zuzu is nowhere to be found and I have so little time to look for him. So, I asked around to see if anyone knew of someone who could take his place, a stand in if you will. The guards told me of you.”

“You’re the right height, you have the right build, your hairs in about the same style, and your voices even sound similar. Heck, you were even born in the same month. The only real difference is the scar.”

Suddenly, panic struck you. A scar! Oh spirits, she was going to burn you. Your whole body shook with a fear you just couldn’t control. You wanted to run, to hide, to scream, to cry, but you couldn’t bring yourself to move. Azula brought her hand up slowly, gently placing her right palm over your left eye. Slowly, she leaned inwards until her lips were beside your right ear.

“Don’t worry, I’ve already made some arrangements to help you look a bit more like my brother. You will help me, won’t you?” Her words came as a barely audible whisper; low, sinister, and almost seductive. You knew the question was only a formality. A barely perceptible nod of your head was all it took and you found yourself being rushed away.
11411.title: The Next Fire Lord*

114111.content:
Less than an hour later, you found yourself standing outside of a side gate to the palace, cloaked and hooded as you waited on a carriage to arrive. Azula had harped on the importance of secrecy, that her true destination had to be kept secret along with your own involvement. As things stood, the official story was that she was seeking the solitude of a nearby cottage in order to meditate on her upcoming ascension to fire lord. The truth was far less admirable. After the carriage pulled up and everyone boarded, Azula finally filled you in on her plan.

Your real destination was the Boiling Rock, a high security Fire Nation prison surrounded by a boiling lake. Azula had been unable to secure a full size zeppelin this close to the invasion, but she had still managed to get a hold of one of the smaller, prototype zeppelins. The plan was to meet up with the zeppelin crew on the mountain overlooking the cottage sometime after midnight, abandoning their small entourage in order travel quicker. By zeppelin, you would reach the Boiling Rock in a little over six hours, but there was one last thing to take care of before you left; your disguise.

It was this part which worried you most of all. According to Azula, there was a medium of some kind which lived within the woods not too far away. She had sent a messenger to the “spirit whisperer,” as she preferred to call herself, in order to arrange for a disguise good enough to fool both prince Zuko’s girlfriend Mai and her friend Ty Lee that you were in fact Zuko. At this you expressed your doubts, there were many charlatans who claimed to have spirits, but upon speaking Azula had merely silenced you with a look. You spent the rest of the ride in silence.

Night had fallen by the time you arrived at your destination, a small dirt path which meandered into dense woods. Azula immediately dismounted, motioning for the escort to wait as you moved to follow her. You eyed the shadowed pathway, feeling worried at the prospect of entering such a place without the protection of armored firebenders. However, a glance at Azula’s impatient face half lit by the moonlight quelled such thoughts.

“Stay close and keep silent.” Azula’s voice stood out against the dead silence of the night as you left the carriage behind and entered the woods before you. An eerie mood hung in the air as you followed your lord into the woods, wisps of fog nipping at your ankles.

The moon was a scant crescent hanging in the sky, offering little light. However, it was enough to cast shadows through to where it broke through the canopy above, making imagined beasts suddenly rear up only to sink back into the ground a moment later. The hair on the back of your neck stood on end as you fought the urge to run. Suddenly, you jumped as a fire blazed up ahead; banishing much of the darkness and causing the shadow beasts to retreat.

Azula stood before you, as calm and serene as if she were in the brightest hall. The hellish firelight cast a played across her face and setting her eyes afire, making her look for all the world a demon in the night. You had a moment to wonder whether the shadows were retreating from her light, or whether they were fleeing from her.

The sound of a cleared throat rent the air, and suddenly you realized what she intended. You felt foolish. Here you were, a trained Fire Nation guard afraid of a little darkness. Quickly, you used your own bending abilities, igniting a flame within your hand and further banishing the haunting shadows.

Azula turned around once more and strode off, leaving you to follow without a word. Despite your lights, the forest seemed to hover; thick, leafed branches looming menacingly as if about to snatch you from the ground. However, you felt oddly safe with Azula by your side. If there truly were demons lurking in the darkness, they were nothing when compared to Azula.

After walking in the fire lit darkness for fifteen minute, Azula suddenly halted. Caught off guard, you nearly ran into her as you struggled to stop.At first you couldn’t tell why she had stopped, for the firelight had robbed you of all night vision. However, after a moment the reason became apparent. Something was out there, lurking in the darkness.

“Come out where I can see you.” Azula’s cold voice seemed to hold an edge to it, like the sound a knife makes as it’s pulled from its sheathe, yet no response came. Annoyed, Azula suddenly lifted the arm in which her flame rested, filling the night sky with a pillar of ghostly blue flame nearly twenty feet tall. It burned straight through the branches above, setting the canopy ablaze and raining charred bits of wood upon the two of you. Though the sudden light still left you blinking, your own flames had robbed you of night vision, sparing you much of the blinding effect. As you looked out at the dense forest around you, you saw nothing. Perhaps you had only imagined the movement.

“They said I would know you by your blue flames.” The voice was a cold rasp, like dry bones rubbing together. It was almost otherworldly, and if possible filled you with even more fear than Azula did. However, no matter how hard you looked you couldn’t find the source of the voice.

“And so you know me. Come out.” It was apparent that Azula was running thin on patience. Her voice was wound tight, as if she wanted nothing more than to burn the entire forest down. Instead, she lowered her flame once more. It returned to the docile flame it had been before, however it remained blue as opposed to the brilliant orange it had been before.

Suddenly, an old woman seemed to materialize from behind a tree. Her long, white hair seemed brittle at straw and barely any flesh seemed to cling to her bones. She was wrinkled and hunched, yet her eyes blazed with an ageless light.

“This is the one?”

“Yes.” Azula’s answer was curt. Looking closer, you even saw a bead of sweat fall down her cheek. Could she be… frightened!? No. It was impossible. However, the more you looked, the more you became sure.

Suddenly, you felt the urge to run like never before. Azula was afraid! What had you gotten yourself into? You realized suddenly that no one knew where you were, that if you were to disappear right now, no one would know a thing about it. You struggled to run, to flee, to get away as fast as you could, but you found you couldn’t move a muscle.

“A protective charm, to fight off half the curse.” It was the crone again, yet somehow she was directly in front of you, lifting a necklace over your head. She was so close that you could smell her breath, a dense wave of moist garlic and rot. Fear strangled you, threatening to choke the air from your lungs as the fire in your frozen hand went out.

The next few minutes were spent breathing rapidly, unable to move. Otherworldly creatures flew overhead and monsters danced amongst the fog. The old crone sang and chanted and mumbled words you couldn’t understand. Azula stood off to the side, watching intently as the witch did her work, her eyes gleaming with morbid fascination. Eventually searing pain overcame your body, breaking whatever spell had held you as a scream tore from your lungs. Darkness closed around your vision as the ground rushed upwards to meet you and you knew no more.
114111.title: By Firelight*

choices: Azula Enters a Room with both Ty Lee and Mai
1141111.content:
“Now, do you remember why you’re here?” Azula’s cool whisper glided over you once more, snapping you back to the present. What was happening? The witch was supposed to have made you look like Prince Zuko, not shrink you. Mildly panicked, you called out to the towering figure above, momentarily forgetting you fear of Azula as you demanded answers.

“It worked!” The almost childlike twinkle in Azula’s eyes had magnified as your words had reached her, only serving to unsettle you further, and with growing apprehension you realized that she no longer gazed at you as she might a tool, but rather with predatory desire. Somehow, it was infinitely more unnerving than being considered insignificant. Hesitantly, you called out once more, stopping as a grin split the pale visage above..

“You must be wondering what’s going on? Well, you know how I said the witch was going to make you look more like my brother? Well, that wasn’t the whole truth. You see, if I were to drag Zuko in, bound, gagged, and helpless, Mai and Ty Lee would, of course, be distraught. However, that’s not good enough; at least not for what I want. I want them to see my brother, the person for whom they betrayed me, reduced to something… less than human.” Azula paused for a moment, letting her words sink in.

“Granted, I would have rather had little Zuzu here to play with instead of you. In fact, I was originally going to wait until he was captured before carrying out my revenge, but father unexpectedly abdicated his throne to me. Not an unwanted change, mind you, but it forced me to move my plans up none the less. In two days I will become the next fire lord and I’ll no longer have the time to play with my dear brother. The responsibilities of being fire lord and aiding in the war effort will devour all my time, robbing me of my chance at revenge for some time to come. However, having someone who looks just like him is the next best thing.

While you were unconscious, I had the witch put another charm on you. It’s a simple illusion, using what those present know of Zuko to craft the charm. It masks your appearance, facial expressions, voice, and even changes what you say. Why, for a moment I almost forgot you really weren’t my brother, what with your petty defiance. So proud. So naive. Just like little Zuzu.”

Your mind went blank for a moment as the implications ran through your mind. Less than human, Azula considered you less than human at this size. She had been talking about Prince Zuko at the time, so surly she couldn’t have meant you. However, the calculating eyes above you said otherwise. No, you had to stay hopeful. This was your chance to rise in rank, by winning the favor of the next fire lord. Crushing doubts clung to you like cobwebs.

Azula had intended to shrink her brother in order to reduce him to something less than human, and had instead settled for you. Were you less than human in her eyes? Judging by her earlier regard for you, it might be an improvement if she considered you so. Humans were mere tools in her eyes, to be used and discarded, but the desire in her eyes… Was that truly better?

Additionally, the implication that she had almost forgotten you weren’t her brother was unsettling. It might have been a mere jest, but Azula’s hatred for her brother was wildly known. She had even laughed as her father burned Prince Zuko’s face. The thought that Azula might forget who you were, even for a moment, filled you with mortal fear.

You called out to the titaness above you, voicing your concerns on the matter despite, no because of your fear of her. It was one thing to impersonate Prince Zuko at full size, but being shrunken was another thing. You were completely dependent on Azula for your well being, a prospect no sane creature would find comforting. Not only that, but thinking further, nobody but the witch even knew you were shrunken. If you were to just disappear…

As you continued to voice your worries, you quickly realized you were in over your head. You had agreed to help Azula because the alternative, displeasing the next fire lord and losing any chance of political advancement, had left you feeling as if you had no choice in the matter. However, seeing the peril you were in at the moment, such things seemed insignificant. Swallowing, you called out to Azula, announcing that you would no longer be participating in her revenge. Her response came as a surprise.

In fact, it was more the lack of a response that surprised you. It was as if your words didn’t reach her ears. That same predatory grin remained splayed across her face, refusing to even twitch at your open defiance. You had expected outrage or anger, but none of that showed. If anything, she seemed even more excited than before. Looking into her eyes, you noticed a gleam there, something you had neither noticed nor considered before. Was that… madness?

“You’re not very bright are you? I told you, the charm changes what you say. When you speak, I hear my weakling little brother.”

Your blood froze in your veins at her words. No, this wasn’t right. You didn’t want to participate in Azula’s petty revenge anymore. It wasn’t worth it. How could you trust someone who hadn’t even treated you as a person at full size to take care of you in your current condition? How could you trust someone who couldn’t even hear your words?

Despair gripped you and your legs gave out, dropping you onto the hard wood floor of your box. The world around you seemed distant as you contemplated your current condition. You suddenly found yourself hunched over, dry heaving onto the floor. Could things get any worse? A sudden, thunderous rap rang through the room about you and Azula’s face quickly drew away.

“What is it?” Azula tore her gaze from you, lifting her head and gazing towards the door as she spoke. Irritation flooded her voice, causing the guard on the other side of the door to pause before continuing hesitantly.

“We’ve arrived at the boiling rock my lord. The airship will be landing shortly.”

“Excellent. Have the prisoners prepared as per my instructions upon our arrival.”

Shifting her attention back to you, Azula drew closer once more, though not as uncomfortably near as before.

“Though it doesn’t matter what you say, be sure to struggle and speak often enough to keep those traitors worried. Do that, and your reward will be great upon our return to the capital.”

A faint hope glimmered within your chest, but even at Azula’s promises of rewards to come, it failed to take root. The same dread still weighed heavy upon your mind, bringing yet more unsettling questions about things to come.
1141111.title: Back to the present*

11411111.content:
For the next twenty minutes, your life was once more reduced to little more than darkness as Azula slid the lid to your prison home once more, sealing off all light. Without warning, your feet suddenly lost contact with the ground beneath you, the sudden and unexpected movement of Azula lifting your box throwing you sideways into the wall. A soft grunt escaped you as you struck the hard wood, and you quickly slid down to lie flat against the cold floor so as not to be tossed once more.

Within your wooden box, the world seemed to undulate all around you. Azula wasn’t being especially careful while carrying your container, and so it wobbled with her every movement, forcing you to fight off dizziness. With every step, the floor fought to throw you, first rising a short distance before suddenly plummeting, causing your heart to jump in time with your captor’s steps. The rattle of armored guards assaulted you from all around, escorting their next ruler deeper within the Boiling Rock. Thankfully, after what seemed like an eternity, the shaking finally stopped, allowing you the opportunity to regain your composure.

“Leave me.” The ring of command in Azula’s voice was unmistakable, and the guards didn’t hesitate in obeying, judging by the rattling of their armor. However, it soon became apparent that not everyone had left, as without sensing any movement from the one holding your box, the sound of jingling keys reached your ears. Shortly after, there was the sound of grating metal and the scurrying of softly clad feet. A maid perhaps? However, the nauseating gyrations of Azula’s movement soon returned, interrupting your idle thought.

“Leave the box on the table. Then leave me.” Silence hung in the air for a moment, could the maids be hesitating? However, something suddenly sent them flurrying to obey, and all at once the scurry of movement could be heard, along with the sound of a wooden box being placed upon a steel table. Undoubtedly it was one of Azula’s hard looks that had startled the maids to action. However, what was this about another wooden box? The sound of the heavy metal door swinging shut sent an ominous shiver down your spine.

For what seemed like an eternity, nothing happened, but despite that the air seemed to intensify. There was a sense of dread which permeated the atmosphere, almost as if in expectation of an execution. Gradually, the stillness ground at your nerves, like a guillotine poised just above your head. Your mind began to wonder, once more made aware of your helpless state as you waited on another to make in other void. What was Azula waiting for? The silence dragged on, and the darkness around you began to draw closer. Unseen wall pressed in on you, smothering you, threatening to crush you. You struggled for breath, and suddenly found yourself unable to breath. Cold sweat poured from you as claustrophobia began to overwhelm you.

Finally, blessedly, your prison began to shift once more, your stomach rising into your throat at your sudden decent. It felt as if you would fall endlessly, the ground never seeming to reach you as you box descended, until the deafening thump of wood on metal reverberated through you. The shuffling of cloth and the light tap of softly clad feet were lost to you as your ears continued to ring. However, despite the difficulty with which sound reached you, Azula’s malicious, cold voice still found its way into your awareness.

“Hello girls.”
11411111.title: Old Friends*

114111111.content:
“Hello girls.” The pure malice which colored Azula’s voice nearly choked you. Before, the thoughts of revenge had left the fire princess joyous, almost giddy at the thoughts of everything which she would subject her “friends” to in the wake of their betrayal. However, when faced with the object of her hatred, not even the most vicious of revenge could stay her anger. Within your box, you were suddenly glad to be out of sight.

There was a long pause during which only silence could be heard. Anxious, you found yourself holding your breath. The very thumping of your heart seemed so loud in that silence, threatening to break the fragile quiet all about you. Willing it to be still, you waited, willing the silence to be broken while simultaneously fearing that is would be. After a minute or so, Azula resumed speaking once more, her tone now cold and icy.

“I have little enough patience, so I will make this short. My father has ascended to become the phoenix king, leaving the throne empty. By tomorrow, I will have become the newest fire lord. I will have control over law and punishment within the fire nation, including your fates.” Azula’s thinly veiled threats hung in the air for a moment, only adding to the tension.

“When I become fire lord, my free time will become limited. I will not be able to visit you as I am today. So, I will give you one chance, though you by no means deserve it. Beg for forgiveness and swear to serve me until the day that your traitorous bones are buried and I’ll set you free once the conquest is finished.” Despite Azula’s best efforts, her anger could not be fully contained, coloring her voice once more. It had only been a few days since Mai and Ty Lee had betrayed Azula at the boiling rock, and the news had not yet become public knowledge, so you did not know who it was that could inspire such hatred from the fire princess. Confused, and disturbed, the following pause hung heavily upon your shoulders.

“I’ll also have control over the fate of my brother.” Azula’s voice seemed to remind you of nothing more than a snake slithering through the grass. It was quiet, cold, calculating, and malicious. It astounded you that anyone could bear her attention without breaking into sobs, let alone refrain from responding.

The sound of someone spitting broke the silence.

A shocked stillness filled the room, and from within your prison your stomach dropped. Could what you are hearing truly be going on? Could anyone truly be brave enough to spit in the Azula’s face? No, you must be mishearing things. The darkness of the box was causing your imagination to run wild. Stunned, you waited, having forgotten your fears at the sheer impossibility of what you thought you were hearing.

It was a long while before Azula deigned to respond.

“So, that’s your answer.” Azula’s voice was a mixture of disbelief, shock… and was that laughter? No, that couldn’t be laughter. It seemed twisted somehow, wrong. A gasp could be heard from somewhere nearby, the first sign of any other person save your captor occupying the room.

Cautiously, almost delicately, fingers gently probed at the lid to your box. Terror once more clutched at you as you realized that Azula was planning opening your prison, preparing to take you out. Your mind raced, gleaning from Azula’s words that whoever it was she held captive valued prince Zuko very highly and connecting that with the fact that you now wore his face. You could feel tears starting to form in your eyes at the implications, and you found yourself driven into the furthest of the box by sheer panic. Tenderly, almost lovingly, the lid to your box was removed, allowing soft firelight to once more reach you. Suddenly, it became very apparent what had caused the other captive to gasp.

Azula’s face, with its pale skin and ruby lips, was a twisted visage of unrecognizable emotions. Her eyes were wide and wild, the pupils dilated as they fixated upon you. Those pale, beautiful lips were twisted in some sick combination of a smirk and a snarl. Her eyebrows were drawn in an almost confused manner, as if Azula herself was unable to comprehend her own emotions. Shrouded in shadow, it was a face of madness that stared down at you, seeming almost hungry as Azula focused on the morsel before her.

Gingerly, those slender fingers of hers made their way into the box, lurching stiffly towards your tiny form. You curled into the smallest ball possible, trying desperately to push yourself into the corner and away from her clutches. Her finger tip wedged itself between yourself and the wall, pushing you free with barely any effort. The tears which had begun to cloud your eyes began to fall as you struggled in her sickeningly gentle grip, trying desperately to break free.
114111111.title: A Happy Reunion*

choices: Azula Offers a Way for the Girls to Save Zuko
1141111111.content:
Despite the reverent care with which Azula seemed to carry you, your worries only grew. Normally, when someone carried anything with such care, it was because the object in question was valuable to them. However, based on the few interactions you had had with Azula, you knew that to her, nothing had an innate value. Not even human lives. No, Azula only valued things according to their usefulness, and judging by the tender way in which she lifted from your box, it was apparent she felt you were very useful. In combination with the mad expression on her face and her expressed intention for revenge, that almost reverent grip seemed more like a bear trap, waiting to be sprung. However, it wasn’t until you were drawn fully from your container and Azula had rotated around to expose you to her captives that you realized the true gravity of your predicament.

As you were rotated around, you took in your surroundings. The room was a plain affair, with a single torch on the wall to the side. The walls were of plain, unadorned stone, and near the front of the room was a clean, windowless, iron door. Within that room, a steel table had been dragged in, and upon it rested two boxes and a bag. It was then that you noticed the other side of the room, walled off as it were by vertical iron bars, and the captives that lay within.

Despite only having witnessed them from afar within the palace, the two captives were easily recognizable. On the left, sitting upon the floor, sat the once cheerful Ty Lee, now seeming considerably grimmer. Though the brown rags she now wore were far less revealing than her usual, expensive clothing, her career as an experienced acrobat was still apparent. Her body was tight and lean, the calves and forearms showing smooth flesh and well turned muscles where they were exposed. Her brown shirt seemed to be a few sizes too big, her small breasts and slim belly failing to fill out the shirt even a fraction. Her tangled brown hair seemed dirty, and what little you could see of her down cast face reaffirmed your suspicion. The scent of unwashed flesh mixed with the smell of soot from the torch nearby, adding an unclean feel to the air.

The person standing in the center of the floor seemed to be in no better condition. Though not as lean or muscular as Ty Lee, Mai was rather slender as well. She too wore the same brown clothing, though she seemed to flesh them out far more. However, whereas Ty Lee seemed to be content to passively sit in the corner, Mai stood defiantly in the center, her black hair wildly framing her intense, auburn gaze. That gaze turned first to confusion, and then disbelieving shock as it rested upon you.

Your mind began to race at the implications of such a circumstance. Azula’s two greatest supporters and enforces lay in prison, under charges of betrayal and treason. What had happened between the three? Running over Azula’s words once more, another question rushed to the forefront of your mind. What did Zuko have to do with this? Suddenly, it came to you, and the reason for which Azula suddenly treated you as if you were a treasure became apparent.

Azula’s two closest friends, if she’d ever had any, had betrayed her. Azula wanted revenge. Mai was dating Zuko. You looked like Zuko.

Suddenly, you fought like crazy to break from Azula’s grasp, screaming and struggling as if possessed. You didn’t care that you were being held at what seemed an insane height, or that breaking free would likely end in your death. None of it mattered in light of the possibility of being tormented as a means of revenge against those who had been almost sisters to the fire princess, and then betrayed. What’s more, Azula seemed to have taken the blow unexpectedly hard, perhaps even having a lapse in sanity as a result. What she was capable enough without any personal motivations was the stuff of nightmares. Unhinged as she was and driven by loathing and hatred, even dropping to your death seemed more desirable than being left to her whim.

“Spirited as always, isn’t he?” Azula’s expression glowed dully with some sort of mad light, not quite fully out of control, but clearly unstable. However, there was somehow also a dejected tone to her voice, likely at her recent betrayal. One might have even called her fragile, had they never met her before. Her smile, twisted and cold as it had been before, seemed immeasurably more unsettling.

“Zuko!” Forgetting her silence, Mai threw herself against the bars in a mad effort to snatch her perceived lover from Azula’s lightly clasped hands, only to have Azula pull her hands just out of her reach. Between gaps in your captors fingers, you could see Ty Lee jump to attention, looking about in apparent confusion, seeking the source of her friend’s desperation.

“How? I don’t understand.” Mai’s disbelief echoes in her voice.

“You’ve known me for years Mai. Did you really think anything was beyond my capability?” Azula’s voice was almost a groan, tainted by an incomprehensible mixture of emotions, but mostly coming across as mockingly chastising.

“Release him!” Ty Lee’s confused inquiries could barely be heard beneath Mai’s demand, the young chi blocker having yet to catch onto the situation. A dark glint flashed in Azula’s eyes.

Suddenly, the hand beneath you tilted sideways, and you felt yourself begin to plummet. Despite your earlier struggles for exactly this outcome, survival instinct forced you to scramble for any hold, trying desperately to arrest your fall. Your flailing hands found nothing. However, barely a fraction of a second after having been released, a crushing pressure clamped down upon your left calf, eliciting a shriek of pain.

“No!” Had Azula not forbidden any guards from standing outside the cell, even the most experienced warden would have felt ill at the desperate horror in Mai’s voice. An expression of nausea flashed across Ty Lee’s face as realization stuck her, causing her to place a hand upon her belly and haunch over as if she were going to be ill. Looking up, you noticed your leg caught painfully between Azula’s thumb and middle finger.

“You should be more careful what you say.” A bitter chuckle rumbled from Azula’s throat. Ty Lee’s retches only accented your despair.
1141111111.title: Object of Revenge*

choices: Azula Begins to Reveal her Game
11411111111.content:
Tears dribbled freely down Mai’s cheeks as her wide, desperate gaze remained locked upon your dangling form, following your struggles with desperate alarm. Despite the poor lighting, white knuckles stood out within the darkness where Mai’s hands clenched the bars of her cell fiercely. Had she the opportunity, there was little doubt she would have leapt upon Azula, regardless of her deadly fire bending. Unfortunately, reality offered her no such chance, and she remained helpless as she watched her former lord torment her lover. Weakly, the young noble’s knees gave out and she slid downward towards the floor, her iron grip holding her upright.

“I accept your terms.” The words were so quiet and fragile, that even dangling a few feet from the defeated woman, you could hardly hear them. Though your leg was growing numb from where Azula held you by it, you had calmed down since your initial drop, allowing the broken woman before you to claim your full attention.

Where before, Mai had seemed defiant, she now seemed fragile and vulnerable. Crumpled on the floor as she was, you still didn’t miss the way her body trembled, like a leaf in a breeze. Her once vibrant, pale skin now seemed sallow and devoid of life. Her eyes were like deep wells, her very soul open to you as she continued to stare up at your miserable form. For one brief, insane moment, you couldn’t help but feel jealous of Zuko for having the love of such a woman.

“I see. So, now that I’ve shown you the whip, you want the honey? After you spat in my face, you now seek forgiveness? I offered you friendship, and the chance to return to my side. I actually showed weakness, in seeking your return when I should have sought your traitorous heads. You actually think that after rejecting so generous an offer, I would actually allow you to just accept my terms?” Azula began in cold tone, almost sad sounding. However, as she spoke, her voice began to rise higher, growing tighter and louder as her anger built. To punctuate her statement, a fireball erupted in her free hand, filling the room with its brilliant blue glow.

“I should burn him to ash.” Azula brought the flame closer to you, and you quickly struggled to try to get away from it. You suddenly found the air around you chokingly hot, and sweat jumped from your pores, soaking your clothing. You screamed and kicked, trying to fight off the encroaching heat, but you were having trouble breathing as your tiny body rapidly began to heat up.

“Stop it!” Mai’s scream was half choked by sobs as she continued to plead with Azula, begging that she spare her lover. Ty Lee, still on her hands and knees, merely turned her head upwards to gaze at the scene, shaking in shock as she merely looked on, helpless. Azula let the flame burn on for a couple seconds before quenching it.

As you hung suspended, you were grateful for the reprieve from the flame. It was strange, how fast the heat had penetrated your body, making you feel as if you were going to roast alive. Perhaps it was a side effect of being so small, that the heat had less body to warm up before you would be burnt crispy. That thought, combined with the blood rushing to your head, was starting to make you nauseous. The world around you seemed to be spinning slightly, and you suddenly found yourself feeling cold. Hoarsely, you cried out to Azula, pleading with her to relinquish your numbing leg.

Surprising, the high peeping of your voice seemed to catch her attention, as the fire princess sharply spun her head to face you. Almost as if she could understand you, Azula settled you onto the palm which had just moment ago held the fireball, filling you with both apprehension and relief. However, as she relinquished your leg and blood flow returned to it once more, new pain flashed through you. Within your captor’s harsh grip, the circulation had been cut off, and now that it had been returned, agony raced up your leg. Trying to sooth your pain, you rubbed at your leg, rolling around in an effort to give vent to the discomfort which gripped you.

“Look at you. Your love for him has made you weak, and cowardly.” Facing Mai once more, Azula sneered at the broken noble, as if at something unpleasant.

“But tell me, do you really want me to spare my dear brother? Do you really want to leave him in my care for who knows how long, in this state, to be used and abused as I see fit? Wouldn’t it be better if I simply burned him right now and got it over with quickly?” The sickened silence which followed spoke volumes. Mai was caught, with her lover trapped between death and torment, and she powerless to save him. She knew Azula and the twisted way her mind worked. Azula wanted an answer, wanted Mai to choose how Zuko should meet his fate, and Mai could not give her one.

Several minutes of silence passed, during which your leg once more regained feeling other than the blazes of agony which had ravaged it. Thankfully, it was alright, if badly bruised at the ankle. However, it was the least of the worries as your fate hung in the balance. This hadn’t been in Azula’s deal, but then again, you weren’t surprised by the way your captor treated you anymore. Azula valued a person by their usefulness, and your usefulness was as leverage against those who had betrayed her. Regardless if she saw you as more valuable alive or dead, you doubted you’d ever be restored to your former size.

“Wait!” Surprisingly, it was Ty Lee who spoke up, her weak voice breaking the tense silence which hung in the air. Both Azula and Mai turned to face the girl, her slender limbs shaking as she staggered to a stand.

“You wouldn’t have come all this way to simply play head games. That’s too simple for you. You have something else in store. Something we’d have to do to ourselves in order to save Zuko… Name it.” After Ty Lee spoke, there was a shocked moment of silence before a cat-like smile split Azula’s face.

“It’s good to see you learned something of me during our long years of friendship. Yes, I have a third option.” You could tell Azula was growing excited by the beat of her pulse beneath you. However, no outward signs showed. Subtly, you noticed a deep intake of breath, before the fire princess released it all in one silent huff. Though she would have certainly preferred it had the girls simply accepted her first offer, Azula was a planner if nothing else. In the wake of her anger, she was anticipating this next part.

“How do you feel about a game?”
11411111111.title: The Third Option*

114111111111.content:
“What kind of game?” Despite her hesitation, hope glowed faintly in Mai’s voice. Before, her love’s demise had seemed a sure thing, but now? It was never a good idea to show hope around Azula, as she had a knack for crushing it, but somehow Mai couldn’t help herself.

“It’s a simple game really, and very easy for you to win, depending on whether or not you truly love my brother. You do love my brother, don’t you?” A dangerous grin played across Azula’s face as she spoke, sending a shiver down all three of her captive’s spines. However, as soon as Azula had offered a chance for Zuko to be spared, Mai had known that she was trapped. Whatever game the next fire lord wanted to play, she’d play. The still kneeling noble gave a wordless nod at her tormentor’s question.

“Do you love him enough to die for him?” Azula’s questions continued, her intense eyes focusing upon Mai with an unnatural sharpness. It was almost as if she were staring into the young girl’s soul, watching for hesitation or weakness.

“Of course!” Mai answered without hesitation, looking determinedly ahead at Azula. Whatever game she wanted to play, Mai intended to win. She had no choice. Not if she wanted to save Zuko.

“Would you kill for him?” This question caught Mai off guard. She’d expected to have to sacrifice something in exchange for Zuko’s life, so this line of questioning seemed peculiar. Mai had been part of Azula’s entourage, had fought with her in combat, and had killed at Azula’s command on a number of occasions. Why then would ask a question to which she already had the answer?

“Yes…” Mai’s answer was unsure. Something was wrong, though she didn’t know what. Azula was leading them towards something, though she couldn’t guess what was going through her demented captors mind. Suddenly, Azula turned towards Ty Lee, who had finally regained her composure enough to stand just behind Mai.

“And what about you? You were willing to betray me on behalf of Mai’s love. Would you be willing to kill for it?” Azula’s voice dropped to a low growl, and from your place upon her hand, you could actually feel an eager shake beginning to move through her hand. Your apprehension was mounting as the conversation continued to progress, with all this talk of killing and dying. You didn’t like the direction Azula was steering this conversation.

“Yes.” Ty Lee’s answer was curt and swift, her determination apparent as she evenly met Azula’s gaze. Looking at her now, you wouldn’t have guessed that this girl had been fighting her stomach mere moments ago. Though Ty Lee had always seemed soft to you when you’d viewed her from afar, it was apparent now that she was made of tougher stuff when her friends were concerned. A pang of jealously shot through you at the thought.

“And how many lives do you think Zuko’s is worth?” The confusion on the girl’s faces only grew as Azula’s questions grew less and less predictable, along with their misgivings. Azula had a way of planning ahead of her enemies, but the girls had been with her for a while now. They should’ve at least be able to get an idea of where her plans might lead. However, at the moment, Ty Lee and Mai were completely in the dark, and that truly terrified them. Azula paused, as if waiting for an answer, before continuing.

“Well, I guess I’ll have my answer soon enough.” The world suddenly swirled as Azula turned once more to face the table, the hand in which you rested gently whipping around with her.

The only time you had gotten the chance to look at the table had been when Azula had first pulled you out, and you had been a terrified mess then. Who were you kidding; you were still a terrified mess. However, you could only be terrified out of your mind for so long before fear lost its potency. Though you still felt utter horror at your circumstances, your feelings no longer hampered you judgment so much, and you were beginning to regain some sense of composure. At the moment, you were able to take in your surroundings, seeing what you had missed before.

As you had noted before, three objects rested upon the plain table which adorned the cell. The first, and most familiar of the objects, was the wooden box in which you had been carried, plain and unadorned. On the far end rested a cloth bag of some sort, from which odd protrusions could be seen pressing against its interior. However, it was the third object which suddenly held your attention. A small, unopened box rested between the afore mentioned objects, forebodingly similar to your own.

1141111111111.content:
The room seemed to have fallen deathly silent as the captives suddenly became aware of the second box upon the table, and everything it might suggest. Gently, Azula reached out towards the box, savoring the moment as she rested her hand lightly upon the lid. Taking a deep breath, she gently slid the top off, the dull sound of wood scraping against wood seeming unnaturally loud in the tiny room. As the dull torchlight illuminated the interior of the box, five figures came into view.

Warning bells went off within your head as you realized with sinking surety that you recognized these people, though you’d never seen them before. They were all young, of that you were sure, and to varying degrees given their ranges in height. Of the two boys, one was significantly younger than the other, perhaps twelve or thirteen, with a short buzz of black hair. The other seemed to be a few years older, at perhaps fifteen or sixteen, with a disheveled long black hair and dark skin which suggested southern origins. He looked to be water tribe, though which one you could not tell.

Moving on towards the women, the youth of these captives became even more apparent. The first to catch you attention was a young girl, who couldn’t have been any older than eleven by you judgment. Her black hair was a disheveled mop which had likely been held back in a bun of some sort, and her pale skin and thin physique suggested nobility, though you couldn’t be sure by the amount of dirt which clung to her. To her side, a taller girl stood offering support, her long black hair trailing past her shoulders and her dark skin suggesting southern origins as well. She looked vaguely similar to the elder boy, and you thought that they might be related, though you couldn’t be sure. Off to the side, standing to the side of the oldest male, stood another woman, her short brown hair hanging in a tangled mess upon her neck.

Despite their disheveled appearances and their prisoner garb, something seemed dreadfully familiar about the prisoners arranged defensively within the box. Two siblings from the water tribe, a small girl of noble birth, and a young boy. It sounded too familiar. Thoughts whirled within your head until the answer finally came to you.

Impossible. This couldn’t really be… them. Could it? No! Had the avatar actually been caught, the fire lord would have paraded his corpse around for all to see. You would have surely heard about such an occurrence. No! This had to be a trick, a lie. Zuko was a part of the Avatar’s group. Had he been caught, you wouldn’t be in your present plight.

The hag! The answer rushed to you all at once, filling you with dread. The hag had been able to transform you in a matter of an hour. Could she not have done the same to others? Looking closer, you took in the forms below you once more, noticing small discrepancies. Every face was set in firm defiance, and any who dared look upon Azula did so with a glare. However, though their expressions looked fierce, the enchantment placed upon them did nothing to disguise the way they shook or hide their tears. A jolt of horror shot through you as you realized they were even more terrified than yourself.

Your dread only grew as you realized that they were likely random prisoners Azula had picked to serve her purpose. Judging by their age, they were likely petty thieves or war prisoners. What else could youths such as these have done? Surely, they could not have done anything bad enough to deserve death as tools for Azula’s revenge. Likely just as confused as frightened, their disposable nature having almost assured that Azula had opted not to give them the light explanation she had afforded you. After all, she didn’t care how they acted, so long as you didn’t do anything to make the girls suspicious of your identity. As if undeserved death hadn’t been enough, the captives had been rendered powerless to express their own terror and grief, instead being forced to wear these twisted visages of false ferocity. Idly, you wondered if your face was just as fake.

Azula grabbed the box by its edge, and the world once more swayed as she turned to face the captives once more, the boxes contents plain for all to see. Disbelief once more colored the girl’s expressions as they took in the sight, overlooking the small discrepancies in their shock.

“Five lives, to be executed as I choose, as proof of your undying loyalty to me and your regret at your betrayal. In exchange, I will see to it that my brother is taken care of, and upon conquering the other nations you will be released to serve me once more, with Zuko as my hostage. This is my final offer. Take it or leave it.” Azula almost seemed impatient as she spoke, as if her words were a mere formality spoken before the main event. Well, they were, after all. At least, judging by Mai and Ty Lee’s faces, they were. Never before had you seen such resignation and such helplessness conveyed through a look as when the girls glances at one another, having just torn their gaze from the box and its contents. So much raw emotion was conveyed by that momentary meeting of eyes. Despite your own peril, your heart went out to them.

“I accept your offer.” Mai’s voice quivered as she spoke. Ty Lee’s voice soon echoed.

“A wise decision. However, my trust in your word is a little thin at the moment. So, if you go back on your word, not only will you never see daylight again, but whatever execution method you fail to carry out I’ll instead inflict upon Zuko. Myself.” A chill shot down your spine as she spoke, and the girls paled in response. A long, deadly silence hung in the air for a moment as everyone took in Azula’s meaning.

“So, shall we begin?” Azula’s face tightened into a soul shriveling grin, the lights of madness from before once more dancing within her eyes.

Azula's words hung in the air like a knife, bringing the room to silence once more. Deliberately, Azula returned the box full of prisoners back to the table, turning her back upon Mai and Ty Lee in the process. She seemed almost relaxed as she gazed down at her soon to be victims, taking in their pitiful forms. The tension in the air continued to build as Azula took her time, selecting who would live and who would die.

Simultaneously, you wished this moment would both end already and never pass. On the one hand, you felt you were going to puke, knowing that Azula was playing with you all. There wasn't a doubt in your mind that Azula was purposefully dragging out this moment, just to allow everyone else to squirm. For the victims below, her decision would either postpone their execution or hasten it. For the noblewomen in their cell, it would decide whose life they would be forced to take in what was sure to be both a gruesome and intimate manner. For yourself, it was a reminder of your worth to Azula, and what she might do to you were you to lose your value. At that moment, the suspense of it all seemed far worse than death. You just wanted it to be over already.

However, on the other hand, once this moment passed, someone would die. Not only that, but if the execution was too gruesome for Mai and Ty Lee to carry out, it would be your head on the chopping block. You feared what dark executions Azula had planned more than death itself, and would have given anything to escape the situation, to have refused the fire princesses request.

However, the moment couldn't continue forever. Having come to a decision, or more realistically decided that the tension had built up enough, Azula's free hand descended upon the frightened forms below. Despite your vantage point upon her free palm, the back of her hand obscured your view momentarily as her nimble fingers went to work, gently plucking some doomed soul like a cherry. As her hand retracted, the struggling form of the avatar came into view. Azula turned to face the girls once more, her prize visible even in the dim torch light.

'I think it only fitting that the leader goes first. Wouldn't you agree?' Azula's eyebrows were arched up, almost as if inviting the girls to argue. However, the girls' fighting spirit had already been doused. As Azula approached the bars to their cell, they meekly awaited her.

'Hold out your hands.' At Azula's command, it was Mai who moved forward. Her once finely manicured hands now showed signs of dirt and neglect as they slid between the bars. They trembled slightly as the avatar, or the poor soul who wore his face, was deposited within their grasp.

114111111111111.content:
In stark contrast to the discomfort that crept upon Mai’s face at the sensation of having a miniature person resting upon her palm, Azula positively radiate pure satisfaction. She was enjoying every second of Mai’s and Ty Lee’s anxiety, practically reveling in it, perhaps a bit too much. In what might have been impatience, the soon-to-be fire lord cut her teasing short.

“You were my attendants, my comrades, and together we crushed countless enemies beneath our heels. However, it seems that you forgot your place when you betrayed me for my brother. Prove your loyalty now. Place the avatar upon the ground.”

Shaking, Mai somberly obeyed, placing the “avatar” upon the floor of her cell. However, the frightened figure fought to cling to her hand, clearly afraid of what was to come. Seeing his fright, you were suddenly reminded of your own reason for being selected for Zuko’s double. You were not only of similar build to the traitor prince, but of nearly the same age. How old was the avatar, twelve? Seeing the trembling figure on the ground below, you had little doubt the he shared such a similarity to the one he was impersonating.

“Remind the avatar of his place. Trap him beneath your foot.” A predatory fierceness was like iron in Azula’s voice, adding a new edge to her demands.

Her uncertainty redoubled, Mai slowly placed her foot upon the avatar, nearly recoiling at the sensation of squirming beneath her sole. Clasping the bars to her cell for support, she couldn’t help but cringe as the hair on the back of her neck bristled at the alien sensation. She could feel the figure struggling to break free, but knew better than to let him, lest Azula take out her ire on Zuko. So, despite her urges not to, Mai struggled to hold the avatar beneath her foot, revolted at the ticklish flailing going on beneath her toes.

The experience was far more horrifying from your perspective. Below, a reaffirmation of everything you had feared up till now was taking place. It could just as easily be you down there, struggling beneath Azula’s sole. You would be just as helpless; awaiting the moment she dropped her weight upon you and ended your existence. You were powerless, and you life no longer rested within your own hand, just like the “avatar’s” life was beyond his own control.

For entirely too long, Azula refrained from giving the death sentence, choosing simply to watch and enjoy Mai’s discomfort. She was almost enthralled by the sight, and with a startling realization, she realized that the sense of empowerment she had received when she had been appointed the next in line to become fire lord almost paled in comparison to this. There was just something so visceral about the dread which hung in the air, the complete control she had over all these fools. It was the growing dampness between her legs that finally startled her from her trance, taking even Azula by surprise.

“Enough. Crush him.” Azula’s voice held the unmistakable weight of absolute control. The coldness with which she sentenced this stranger to death was all the sharper for it.

“Five lives, to be executed as I choose, as proof of your undying loyalty to me and your regret at your betrayal. In exchange, I will see to it that my brother is taken care of, and upon conquering the other nations you will be released to serve me once more, with Zuko as my hostage. This is my final offer. Take it or leave it.” A jolt of panic shot through Taro’s body, and he could sense similar reactions from the four others trapped within the box. Taro was a boy of thirteen, born and raised in a small village in the eastern earth kingdoms. He was an only child, fun loving and cheery, even in the face of the fire nation incursion. His parents, however, were rebels. With the help of their coconspirators, they had worked to undermine the fire nation authority not only within their village, but in the surrounding countryside. When their involvement in the resistance had been finally uncovered, the fire nation had chosen to take Taro as a hostage in order to coerce his parents into turning over the remaining members of their rebel movement. That had been three years ago, three long years of imprisonment. By now his parents had been executed, though that hadn’t stopped Taro from latching onto the tiny ray of hope the fire nation officer had offered him a couple of days earlier.

“Do you want to see your parents again?” Though the officer had seemed gruff, he had spoken gently to Taro, showing him kindness he hadn’t experienced in years. Despite his mistrust, Taro had agreed to the man’s terms almost immediately, seeing little alternative other than continuing to rot in his cell. Of course, he hadn’t expected the witch, nor had he been privy to either Azula’s plan or even her involvement. The fire nation officer had only told Taro that he’d be participating in a ritual, acting as the voice through which summoned spirits could speak. Though a terrifying prospect, anything was better than rotting in his cell and the thought of reuniting with his parents once more was just too alluring. However, following the ritual and the discovery of his new size, the boy had immediately regretted his decision.

He hadn’t been the only one to be betrayed either. Though Taro had spent the first few hours following the ritual isolated, he would soon be put in a box with four other shrunken individuals, all of whom were in the same state of confusion as himself. Taro would discover that, though he appeared normal to himself, the others saw him as a different person entirely, with short black hair and strange, arrow shaped markings. Similarly the others had appeared to him differently from how they described themselves. Over the course of the next day, they would share their individual stories of betrayal, feeding one another’s hatred towards the fire nation. It wouldn’t be until they were brought to the boiling rock and overheard Azula’s explanation that realization would dawn upon Taro.

Frantically, Taro cast about, trying desperately to figure out which of them resembled the avatar, which of them was going to die. However, he had spent the past three years in prison, cut off from the outside world. He hadn’t even known that there was a new avatar until the fire princess had mentioned him, let alone how they looked. Terrified, Taro prayed to the spirits that it wasn’t he who wore the Avatar’s face. Most of Azula’s words passed over Taro, his raw fear obscuring their meaning.

However, Taro became aware of his surroundings once more as Azula moved, carrying the box and all of its contents back to the table. The boy was thrown from his feet, tumbling to the ground painfully along with the rest of the captives. Recovering, Taro gazed upwards, taking in the sight of Azula gazing down at him. Her eyes were icy cold as they glanced over the captives, calculating, weighing each and every one of them. However, there was also a blazing fire behind those amber portals, a swirling vortex of rage which threatened to spill outward at any moment. Taro shivered at the sight, and realized that he couldn’t stop. One of them was going to die. Taro didn’t want to die.

After what seemed like an eternity, Azula finally smirked, her ruby red lips twitching in a cruel parody of a smile, signaling that she had reached a decision. Slowly, so painfully slowly, her hand descended. Like death itself, it crept closer, the embodiment of doom for all those beneath it. With an awful realization, Taro noticed that it was heading straight towards him. He screamed, throwing himself away from the approaching digits, desperately wishing to escape. He barely made it a few steps before he was swept up, the surprisingly soft hand of the fire princess encircling his struggling form easily.

Tears ran down Taro’s cheeks as he let out a desperate scream, his high pitch voice pitiful to even his own ears. He struggled, kicking and fighting against the hand that held him, until the sensation of rapidly moving upward overtook him. Instinctual panic at falling overtook the boy, and he shifted from fighting Azula to clinging to her for safety. The world spun in a blur as Azula turned to face her captives once more, presenting Taro to the nobles.

“I think it only fitting that the leader goes first. Wouldn't you agree?” Taro trembled as he clung to Azula’s thumb, gazing up in horror. Through watery eyes, he took in Azula’s smug grin. Her eyes were focused on her ex-allies, enjoying their looks of disgust and helplessness. She didn’t even spare a glance for Taro.

“Hold out your hands.” Taro watched as Mai meekly stepped forward, offering a far warmer and gentler visage when compared to Azula, despite her ratty clothing and unkempt exterior. Still, Taro knew her to be his executioner, unwilling though she may be. The boy struggled vainly to cling to the fire princesses hand as she upended her palm over Mai’s, dumping him roughly within her grasp. Without much pause, Azula continued forward.

“You were my attendants, my comrades, and together we crushed countless enemies beneath our heels. However, it seems that you forgot your place when you betrayed me for my brother. Prove your loyalty now. Place the avatar upon the ground.” After a moment’s hesitation, Mai obeyed, her hand carrying Taro downward. The boy’s stomach dropped at the sight of the approaching floor and the sensation of falling, his terror mounting. He wept harder as he struggled to wrap his arms around Mai’s thumb.

“Please, don’t do this.” Taro wailed at the top of his lungs, hoping against hope that giant figure would take pity on him. However, she might not have even heard him, for all the reaction she showed to his pleas. As her hand reached the stone floor, Mai gently shook her wrist, dislodging Taro and flinging him on the floor. The boy only had a moment to take in the surprising warmth of the stone before Azula gave her next command.

“Remind the avatar of his place. Trap him beneath your foot.” With agonizing slowness, Mai complied, lifting her foot and bringing it above the frightened boy. Taro watched, transfixed, as the low fire light was eclipsed by the captive’s sole, the shadow of her foot consuming the boy. In a state of hyper-awareness, Taro took in a sea of details as his death approached.

Despite its recent neglect, Mai’s foot was that of a noble’s and had been well kept. Her toenails were neatly trimmed, their edges unbroken and polished. The spaces between her toes were clean and free of debris. The only real sign that this noble woman had spent some time in a cell at all was the dark collection of dirt which seemed imbedded into the folds of her sole, a cluttering of black upon a sea of pale white. All too suddenly, the appendage was upon Taro, smothering him.

Though the skin beneath Mai’s foot had been well kept until recently, she had never been one of the dainty nobles who stayed at home and studied art. No, her life had been spent by Azula’s side, fighting and killing in the heat of battle. Calloused flesh bored into Taro as Mai struggled to halt his escape attempts, occasionally applying too much pressure and knocking the wind from him. The faint aroma of sweat bombarded Taro as he struggled against Mai’s foot, no longer caring that he had no real escape, his instinctual drive to live lending him power. It was all futile.

As the minutes drug by, Taro actually managed to make a bit of progress, his top half escaping from the cloistered hell and managing to grab a fresh breath of air from between Mai’s toes. However, it was only a momentary reprieve as the digits seized, tightly clamping Taro by the neck. Taro just managed to catch a last glimpse of fire light before he was pulled back into the darkness. From beneath Mai’s foot, he could just make out Azula’s voice.

“Enough. Crush him.” Taro let out a sob, his struggles redoubling.

Your nerves were on edge as you peeked out of your mouse hole to look down both sides of the hall, listening intently. Things in the air temple had been extremely busy as of late, and at a mere two inches tall that meant danger for you. However, as you listened for any signs of passage silence greeted you, disconcerting given that only a moment ago you would have sworn someone had been walking past your hideout. You drew your head back inside, remembering the day that you had been shrunk as you prepared to move to a new, more useful hideout.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Darkness and fog had hampered you vision that night, leaving the man walking in front of you nothing more than a ghostly figure. The soft padding of your footsteps was the only thing which had dared break the silence of the new moon, a soft crunching of leaves in the dark. You had been following him for more than an hour, but hadn’t dared to speak lest you break the silence. The world around you had seemed unearthly as the torchlight played across the shifting shapes, hinting at things moving within. Truth be told, you had been afraid at every little sound the two of you had made, lest some unseen entity take note and seek you out.

Suddenly, another dark figure had swollen up from the darkness, blocking your path. However, your leader didn’t falter. Instead, he had drawn closer, and as the torchlight struck the shadow it had resolved itself into the shape of an old crone, her figure hunched and crooked. Cold blue eyes met yours before she shifted her gaze to your cloaked leader.

“Is this the one?” asked the crone; her voice had been like cracking ice.

“Yes,” Amon, your trusted leader had responded. His voice had been a reassuring break from the silence before.

“The spirits have accepted your price. They have agreed to transform your associate.”

A nod had been Amon’s only acknowledgement.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

What had followed remained ingrained in your mind to this day: the ritual, the spirits, the cackling crone, Amon’s cool gaze. A charm had been forced upon you during the ritual in order to "protect you" from some of its nastier side effects, whatever those were. As the ritual had drawn to a conclusion, you had felt yourself slip into unconsciousness.

By the time that you had awoken you had found yourself considerably smaller, clutched in another soldier’s hand and on your way to the air temple to spy on your leader’s enemies. A mere week later, you found yourself where you stood now, hiding in a mouse hole and preparing to travel to some other destination in the hopes of learning more.

Why you had to carry change hideouts in broad daylight rather than the dark, well it was simple really. To travel during the night you would be required to use a light. Unfortunately, such a light source would act as a beacon to anyone who happened to pass you in the night, guaranteeing that you would be captured. So, you found your only option to be traveling by day. Fortunately, no one ever seemed to look down.

You double checked your pack to make sure that everything was secure. Some supplies, a radio, and various other equipment were the only things keeping you alive and you couldn’t afford to damage anything as you traveled. Sensing the time to leave was nearing, you took a deep breath, cast another glance outside to make sure the hallway was still clear, and boldly stepped out into the hallway.
