When you had initially arrived at the air temple, you had felt lost. The world was so vast! You had never felt so insignificant before in your life. Your escort hadn’t even been able to carry you all the way to the building, lest he be sighted. So, you it had been left to you to ensure your own survival from day one.

The thing about being so small is that the world feels a lot more open. Previously tight corridors suddenly became immense caverns. The smallest hole was a chasm. Instinct had screamed for you to hide, to get out of sight of anything larger than yourself. Shortly after climbing your way into the air temple, you had been grateful for the little mouse hole. However, it hadn’t taken long to realize that your current circumstances couldn’t last.

Sure, from your vantage point you could monitor who entered and left the air temple, but the same could be achieved by watching the docks. Tidbits of information might be overhear every once in a while, but no one spoke of anything important in a hallway. Not only was there nothing to be gained by waiting in such a place, but the large amount of activity in this hallway made it an extremely dangerous place for a two inch tall spy.

You had been terrified at the prospect of leaving you safe haven. Nightmares of wide open spaces and cruel titans towering above had haunted your sleep days before you had finally worked up the courage to depart. However, the radio within your pack was a constant reminder of your duty. Nothing save death would stop you from finding vital information for your cause. You were an equalist!

A corner was fast approaching, its stark end potentially concealing any number of dangers. Fearfully, you approached the edge of the wall, peaking around the corner. An empty hallway met your gaze. This was good. With a little luck you might just reach your destination without any close calls.

Feeling slightly less tense about being in the open, you set off down the hallway at a brisker pace. Nothing stirred ad all was quiet. The temple seemed deserted. A sudden jolt of panic shot through you. Where was everyone? Had you missed some critical piece of information? You increased your pace, eager to find your next hideout.
You reached another corner and slowed once more in order to peak around. Another empty hall greeted you. At this rate you’d be able to find a new hiding place in no time. A small sigh of relief pushed its way between your lips as you considered you luck.

“What’cha doin?” a high pitched voice whispered from behind. At your size it seemed a deafening rasp. Your heart nearly jumped out of your chest you were so startled. You whipped around as fast as you could and nearly fell over backwards.

As your mind began to register what you were looking at, you alarm only grew and grew. A giant pair of lips filled your vision, parted slightly so as to expose a flash of white. Pale flesh encircled the red lips, seeming to be carved of marble. A gust of air blew down on you from above, prompting you to look upwards.

Two caverns filled your gaze, lined with hair and mucus. Even as you watched, another gust of wind erupted from the twin caverns, ruffling the hairs and nearly bowling you over. The realization dawned upon you that you were looking up someone’s nose. Beyond, two steely disks focused on you. Wonder blazed within their depths. Brown hair framed the face of the young girl, two yellow buns barely visible atop her head. Her hands were beneath her chin, supporting her head as she lay on the floor. A yellow collar bellowed outwards, allowing a glimpse down her baggy, red shirt. Little else could be seen of the giant child before you.

“Um, hello,” you voice sounded unsure, even to yourself. After a moment, you was unsure if she had even heard you. You decided to repeat yourself once more, sounding far more confident than you were. This time the girl responded.

“Hi. I’m Ikki. What’s your name?”

“I’m not sure…”

“What are you doing? Why are you out here? Is that a bag? What’s in the bag? Can I see?”

Ikki’s questions rained down one after another. You tried to answer a few of them, but it was like whispering in a typhoon. After a minute, you simply toned her out, instead concentrating on how you might escape the situation.
After a minute, silence snapped you from your thoughts. Ikki had finally stopped talking and was currently staring at you expectantly. She was just sitting there, her face inches from you, staring at you with innocent wonderment. Her face was tilted, reminding you of a curious puppy.

“How long have you been following me?” you finally managed to ask.

“Since you left that mouse hole,” she replied.

“How did you find me?” you asked, concerned by how long she had been able to follow you unnoticed.

“I noticed you peeking out a couple days ago. I’ve been checking up on you ever since.” Looks like you were a bit late moveing.

“Why?”

“Curiosity of course! It’s not every day you get to meet a tiny person.”

You paused to think for a moment. The girl was just curious; she didn’t suspect you were a spy. To her you were just something to ogle for a bit before she got bored. If you played your cards right, it was very likely you would be able to get out of this situation without an issue. Even if the girl told someone about your presence, no one would believe her. All you had to do is get away.

“So, what would you like to know?” You thought it might be best to satisfy her curiosity.

“How’d you get so small?”

An obvious question. However, you thought it best not to divulge any potentially important information.

“It’s a curse. I angered the local mountain spirit back in my home town.”

“Where’s your home town?”

Damn. You weren’t the best at making up things on the fly. You had to keep your story as simple as possible lest you stumble upon your own lies.

“It’s a small village in the eastern earth kingdom. It’s not someplace you would have heard of.”

“How’d you get here?”

“I was accidentally packaged in a crate of cabbage.”

“Why didn’t you seek help when you arrived here?”

That last question sounded a bit too probing. It’s true that if you were here by accident you would probably be seeking help. You had to be careful lest you tip her off to your true purpose.

“It’s awfully hard when nobody bothers to look down. I thought it better to wait for an opportunity rather than risk being stepped upon.” You looked down at that last bit, feigning uncertainty in an attempt to gain her sympathy. However, when you looked back up, her face remained unchanged. She just kept staring at you with those big, curious eyes.

“You’re a bad liar.” Her statement was delivered flatly. It was as if she were stating the weather or saying the time of day, and yet it stabbed you in the chest with its direct accuracy. You recovered quickly, trying your best to play off your pause as hurt.

“What makes you think I’m lying?”

“Because you would have asked for help by now if you truly didn’t want to be here.”

Shit. This little brat was sharp. That also made her dangerous. You had to get away from her before she decided to take you to someone in charge.

“Fine then, don’t believe me. I’ll just go ask someone else for help.” You turned to walk away but an arm came crashing down in front of you, encircling you and cutting off all hopes of escape.

“Just one more question.”

You slowly turned back, looking up into eyes now shining with a predatory intensity.

“Why does your backpack have the equalist insignia on it?”
121131121.title: Found by Ikki

choices: She Takes You to Tenzen and Korra
1211311211.content:
Those silvery eyes bore into you, amusement blazing within their silvery depths. Pale lips moved, but no sound reached your ears. You were in shock you knew, and your perception of the world around momentarily slipped as you realized the enormity of your situation and horror gripped you. Here you were, trapped like a rat by a brat who knew you to be an enemy. Realization dawned on you that your body had broken out in a cold sweat. Ikki’s lips moved again, and this time you managed to catch her words.

“You know, I think I was wrong. I don’t think that will be the last question.” Her words twisted your stomach. Your greatest fears cemented firmly in place. She wasn’t going to let you leave.

Your gaze cast around, looking for an escape but finding none. Where Ikki’s arm didn’t block your path the hallway way wall did. With surety you knew you couldn’t possibly scale her arm and be off before she snatched you up. However, you noticed a small gap between her body and the elbow of the arm which yet supported her head. Maybe, if you could only just slip past…

The girl must have sensed your intentions because her hand quickly dropped away from her chin, snatching you up and smothering all hope.

“Wouldn’t want you escaping would we?” Her voice was playful, like a cat with a mouse.

The mission was a failure. You had been captured, your presence within the air temple had been revealed, and by a seven year old girl no less. Shame might have overwhelmed you at having failed so spectacularly if sadness didn’t have such a death grip on your heart. You had failed your cause, your peers, and everyone whom the equalist movement sought to help. Your miniscule form hung limply within Ikki’s grasp. There was no point resisting anymore.

Without warning, Ikki stood. At your size the motion reduced the world to blurry streaks, leaving your head spinning when she was fully upright. Ikki’s hand was warm, the skin smooth and uncalloused. Her grip was gentle, her hand curving around you to keep you from falling. It was tilted backwards so that you more lay than sat in her hand. He thumb lightly pressed against your chest, securing you lest you fall.

With each step the young girl took your legs swayed back and forth. Between the rocking motion and the way her hand cradled you were reminded of a child be soothed by its mother, and after a minute or so of walking you did indeed start to feel slightly better.

It wasn’t like the movement itself was lost. Sure, you might have turned up some vital information to make victory swifter in its coming, but you could have just as easily been killed. The movement would succeed, it was a just movement after all and highly supported by the people. The only thing that you really felt galled about is that you hadn’t had the chance to contribute, and had instead become a waste of precious resources.

After a while voice became audible, far off but growing closer. Tenzin’s deep baritone stood out, but other voices were apparent. As Ikki carried you closer, the second voice resolved itself to be female.

“Concentrate Korra,” Tenzin instructed, his voice soothing.

“It doesn’t matter how much I concentrate! It just doesn’t click. Air bending’s supposed to be about surrendering yourself but I just don’t think I have it in me to surrender. ” The avatar’s voice was deep for a woman’s. Now that you could identify its owner you noticed it had a very distinct hum about it, rich with laughter and life despite its aggravated tone.

“Now Korra, don’t be discouraged. You’ll learn eventually.”
1211311211.title: Taken Away

12113112112.content:
Even as you listened to the conversation from afar, a fork in your path was approaching. It was apparent that Tenzin and Korra’s voices were coming from the fork on the left. As Ikki drew closer the voices grew louder, filling you with dread.

“This is it,” you thought darkly; “the great and mighty equalist spy, caught by a little girl.” “Well, maybe not so great given your current size,” you amended. However, surprise shot through you as Ikki unexpectedly took the right fork, heading away from the voices. Your mind was abuzz with all the new possibilities.

An ember of hope sparked within your heart as the possibility of escape once more seemed possible. The chances of escape were far greater while in the care of child, as opposed to that of her father. Every second out of Tenzin’s clutches meant another chance to escape. All you needed to do was wait and watch for the moment to make your move.

Ikki continued for a while, bringing you to a part of the temple you which would have taken a week at your size to reach on foot. Looking into one of the rooms to the side, beds and personal belongings were clearly visible. From the décor, you guessed that these were the resident sleeping quarters, as opposed to the guest sleeping quarters. Was Ikki taking you to her room?

“Ikki!” a voice called out. The voice sounded young and feminine, but not so young as your captor. Ikki whipped around, shifting the hand you in behind her back. In her anxiety, her hand gripped you harder than before, forcing the wind from you but otherwise leaving you unharmed. Such a childish tactic wouldn’t fool anyone. All hopes of escape were beginning to turn to ash at the prospect of being discovered by Asami, who would surely turn you over to Tenzin herself.

“I see you hiding something,” Asami’s voice cooed playfully, lightly teasing the young girl. Judging by her tone, she didn’t suspect it was anything too troublesome.

A bit of anger flashed at the thought of young woman. Despite Asami’s father being a major backer of the equalist movement, she did not share the same views. No, she chose to deal with benders and their ilk. When she had finally discovered her father’s loyalties, instead of supporting him as a good true daughter should have she instead had sided with the avatar and her bender friends, saving them and betraying her own blood. The prospect of being captured wasn’t one which set well with you, but the thought of being turned over to Tenzin by the traitorous bitch nearly made you ill.

At the same time, Ikki was worried about her captive being discovered. She wasn’t experienced with lying, and running away would be too conspicuous. She had to think of something quickly, some way to hide her prisoner without raising suspicion. Suddenly, a thought struck her. It was risky and chances were that her little captive wouldn’t appreciate it, but it seemed like the simplest way to keep her prisoner a secret.

Without thinking any further, Ikki made her move. In one smooth motion, she pulled her hand from behind her, brought it upwards towards her lips, and pressed your struggling form against her mouth.
12113112112.title: Thinking Fast

121131121121.content:
Seething with anger and helplessness, you hung limply in Ikki’s hand. That traitor Asami would find you, you thought; it was only a matter of time. Ikki was a bright child, but she was still only a child. Asami had cornered the girl without even realizing. Ikki’s hand tightened painfully around you as she fretter over what to do.

Idly, you wondered what would be done to you once Tenzen discovered your trespass. Would Tenzen keep you? Would the metal benders want you? Would the avatar use some trick to make you talk? The last filled you with fear. With the avatar’s connection to the spirit world there was no telling what may or may not happen. Inertia suddenly forced you against Ikki’s palm and dizziness suddenly overtook you.

Disoriented, you cast about to try to make sense of your circumstance. The world was streaking by at an alarming rate as you felt the hand beneath you rising and twisting. Ikki’s hand was moving quickly, quicker even than when Asami had first surprised her. The centrifugal force of her arm twisting tore at you, causing your neck to flop back and forth.

In a moment you had lost track of your relation to the world amongst the rapid twists and turns. However, your sense of location was restored momentarily as two giant lips appeared, tightly compressed in a worried line. You immediately recognized them as Ikki’s and had a moment to gasp aloud before they snapped open and you were forced towards them.

In the moments before you were to be thrust into that waiting gap, terror took hold. You spread your arms and legs, making yourself as large as possible in your attempts to avoid being eaten. You struck Ikki’s lips, soft as only a child’s lips could be, and held fast. You were no snack. You would not be eaten by some petulant child afraid of getting caught.

A jolt of worry shot through Ikki as you struggled against her lips. If she didn’t hide the equalist soon, Asami would discover the wriggling form against her lips. Panicking, Ikki tried for a second more to push her captive into her mouth, but the wild struggling made it impossible. Switching tactics, the airbender sealed her lips around the struggling spy, attempting to suck him inside instead.

The terror coursing through your veins only intensified as Ikki’s lips clamped down upon you. Ikki’s slender lips worked at your stomach and back as a powerful suction pulled at you, trying with all of their might to force you into her waiting maw. However, she couldn’t for a seal, so the suction was wasted. Her hand pressed against your feet, but you refused to be eaten.

Saliva dribbled onto your upper half, coating your face and choking you. As you gasped for breath, the warm liquid forced its way into your mouth, sending you into a coughing fit. Ikki must’ve brushed her teeth recently because a minty scent hung about the damp cavern, although amidst your terror that you took no note. Strain burned at your arms and legs were protesting when Ikki’s lips finally formed a perfect seal.

As the suction finally began to claim, your limbs were forced together. Ikki’s toothy maw greedily slurped you up and her lips closed behind your booted feet. You flew face first into her closed pallet, your face rubbing against the slimy surface. Ikki’s tongue, a mass of muscle, promptly worked you into her cheek, tucking you behind a row of teeth. Her molars clicked together, trapping you and nearly crushing a hand.

Although the journey into Ikki’s mouth had seemed to take ages, in reality it had been a mere seconds. From being held behind the young girl’s back to being pressed against her lips, it might have taken a second. Your struggles had added a second more, but hadn’t actually been able to halt your progress. Shortly after being forced into Ikki’s cheek, your world tilted forward as Ikki cast her head downward, an expression of guilt on her face.

“I’m sorry,” her voice was garbled from holding you captive. However, from your seat within her mouth the words seemed thunderous, forcing you to cover your ear.

“I was a little hungry,” the young girl continued “so I snuck into the kitchen to grab a snack. I was going to eat something healthy, but those tarts looked so yummy. Please don’t tell my mom.”

Stony teeth pressed against your knees and the top of your head as you remained in the fetal position, shielding your ears. Saliva soaked your clothes, you hair, your skin. It clung to your face, invading every nook of your body and even your mouth. Ikki’s cheek was tight, forcing you against her fleshy gums and pearly whites with a force which rendered movement unthinkable. When Ikki was done speaking, she probed at you with her tongue, its slimy tip probing curiously at you thigh, your stomach, your neck, and the side of your face. Despite the present circumstances, she couldn’t help but sate her curiosity. An unnerved chill ran down your spine as it trailed the curve of your lower back, making you feel like the treat she claimed you to be.

Asami looked searchingly into Ikki’s downcast face for a long moment. One hand was propped on her hip and the other played absentmindedly with her chin. A stern look shown from her face, but even as Ikki watched she could see a smile fighting its way to the surface, giving lie to Asami’s cool demeanor. After a few further seconds of trying and failing to maintain her act, she instead smiled, releasing an amused huff before casually walking up to Ikki and ruffling her hair.

“I won’t tell if you won’t,” Asami said, her amusement coloring her voice. “You shouldn’t scarf down your food so hurriedly. You looked as if you were nearly going to choke.” Asami let out a small chuckle and patted Ikki on the head once more. Ikki tilted her head upwards, managing to smile without revealing her hidden captive before bolting away.

“I won’t tell if you won’t.”

Despite the wet noises that filled the cavern around you, Asami’s words still reached your ears. Not moments ago you would have rejoiced in having avoided the traitor’s attention, knowing that your chances of escape were far greater with Ikki. However, that had been before the girl had crammed you into her mouth.

Presently, terror wrecked your every thought. Although you no longer feared being swallowed, that didn’t mean you were safe. An errant bite or toss of the head could injure you or crush a limb, and even as she ran off from Asami her tongue continued to violate your person, probing every inch of your body in the most unnerving way. You were completely at her mercy.

Darkness greeted your eyes as Ikki kept her lips sealed, lest someone unexpectedly glimpse her prize. The steady sound of breathing rasped away, a soft cadence amongst the sound of wet flesh. Gurgling burbled somewhere near the back of her throat and a burp pushed its way into her mouth, filling the wet chamber with a foul odor. You struggled not to gag.

Suddenly you couldn’t take it anymore. The dampness, the confined space, deadly molars resting beside your head, it was all too much. You cried out, beating against her molars as the gentle sway of Ikki’s steps rocked you back and forth. You were in another person’s mouth. At any moment Ikki had the power to crush your fragile body, ending your life in a spatter of gore. The thoughts were too much as you struggled to break free from your confinement, bracing your booted feet against her cheek and your back against her teeth.

Apparently the discomfort it caused the girl was too much for in a moment she opened her teeth, spilling you onto her tongue. You hadn’t actually been expecting to force your way free, so the sudden impact took you by surprise, robbing you of breath. Despite the pitch darkness, you were familiar enough with a mouth to know where everything was. Her teeth ringed your curled form, trapping you. Behind you, you knew a muscled pit waited, ready to gobble you up. However, on the other side of her teeth you knew freedom awaited.

Beneath you, the tongue heaved violently, trapping you against her teeth and eliciting a crack from within your pack. After a moment, the tongue resumed it investigations, its wet surface first brushing against your face and covering it with saliva. After a minute Ikki apparently grew bored as she instead began to trail the curve of your neck downward until she reached your shirt. This she toyed with vigorously, tearing at its edges and nearly disrobing you before finally moving on to your backpack.

Upon reaching your pack, a single strapped thing draped diagonally across your back, the mighty pink appendage drew back quickly. However, instead of elation filling you at finally being left alone, dread clutched at you instead. Something was off. Suddenly the tongue stabbed at your shoulder, roughly groping at your pack strap in an attempt to rob you of it. She dearly wanted this pack away from you. Thinking back, you remembered the cracking noise from earlier. Could something have broken within your pack and started to leak? An especially rough tug ripped the strap all the way down to your wrist despite your resistance.

As the reality of having all your worldly possessions stripped from you finally sank in, outrage replaced your fear. Your gear, your food, the special clothes you needed to remain insulated, all of it rested within that pack. You couldn’t lose that pack; it was all you had in the world.

Stubbornly, you forced the strap back around your shoulder, firmly crossing your arms to seal it in place. The straining muscle responded by redoubling its efforts, slapping you and pulling fiercely. The slimy tongue speared at you, trying to wedge itself between the strap and you, but you would not submit. This pack was irreplaceable. If the girl wanted it out of her mouth she was going to have to spit you out with it.

A sudden snap could be felt along your shoulder. Horrified, you realized that the strap to your pack had torn. Instinctively you reached out with your hand, grasping the side of the bag desperately in an attempt to keep hold of it. Simultaneously, the tongue snapped outward, hooking the bag and dragging it away from you. You chased after your lost bag, tumbling forward towards Ikki’s gullet and heedless of the potential danger.

Ikki walked towards her room, contemplating her passenger. How could a person become so small? Was it magic? The spirits? Initially, she had intended to take the tiny spy to her father, but the more she had thought on the matter, the less likely it had seemed she would get the answers she desired.

If she turned over her little captive, it was very likely her father would simply leave it to the metal benders to deal with. The equalist would be swept away to the republic city prison where even if the answers to her questions were discovered it would be highly unlikely she would ever hear them. Ikki couldn’t stomach the thought of a mystery such as this remaining unanswered. She would get her answers before she handed the spy off to her father.

Absentmindedly, Ikki released a small burp. Having anything in her mouth always made her mouth water, no matter the nature of the object. The equalist was no exception. Ikki had been forced to swallow frequently to keep from drooling or drowning her passenger, so she couldn’t help releasing a small belch. However, the spy wasn’t so understanding.

Immediately after releasing her belch, the tiny person within Ikki’s mouth began to ballistic. They thrashed and shouted, a bizarre feeling in and of itself. However, the protests didn’t stop there. Momentarily, the equalist managed pressed against Ikki’s cheek and teeth, forming a wedge of uncomfortable pressure against the tender flesh of the young girl’s cheek. If it hadn’t been for that uncomfortable stretching of her cheek, Ikki thought the stimuli interesting. Instead, the young airbender was forced to lower her jaw, separating her teeth enough for her prisoner to shoot onto her tongue.

As her jaw creaked open, Ikki was careful not to open her lips, lest her prisoner slip outside of her mouth. Having alleviated her discomfort, Ikki gently closed her jaw once more, careful not to accidentally injure her passenger. A few moments moment passed and the prisoner began to stir once more. The stimuli was enough to ignite the young girl’s curiosity once more, a feeling Ikki rarely went a day without feeling, yet it seemed to come far more readily where the shrunken person was concerned.

Ikki was curious about many things, but at present it was the equalist’s reactions which intrigued her most. She had decided that her mouth probably afforded the most discreet means by which to transport her charge, and it should’ve been obvious by now that Ikki had no intention of hurting her little charge, yet struggles still emanated from within her mouth. I bit of frustration mixed with the young girl’s curiosity as used her tongue to force the captive against her teeth, as far away from her throat as possible.

As Ikki pressed the spy against her front teeth, she couldn’t help but investigate her captive. Gently, she began to scout the different features of her passenger, starting with the face and making her way downward. The poor thing was shivering in fear, but that didn’t deter Ikki. She pressed on, tugging at their shirt and taking in its bizarre texture. However, even as she teased the shirt a foul flavor was beginning to suffuse her mouth. Her tongue shifted around to the equalist’s back, quickly identifying the backpack as the source of the horrid taste. Fighting down the urge to gag, Ikki quickly decided that the bag had to go!

The young girl didn’t hesitate, immediately aiming for a miniature shoulder in order to work the bag free. The flavor was growing stronger as tainted saliva swept passed the bag, carrying with it the horrid flavor originating from within. The strap was very nearly free of her captive’s arm when the spy suddenly struggled, resituating the strap and firmly clamping down upon it.

Ikki paid little attention as she walked, instead focusing on wrestling the bag free. Sure, she could have simply spit the captive out and saved herself the trouble, but the childish part of her took the equalist’s struggles as a challenge, and Ikki loathed losing challenges. Ikki continued to work at the pack, seeking some advantage to pry it loose, but the spy wouldn’t budge. At this point it was all Ikki could do not to choke, the taste was so intense.

As Ikki approached the turn leading to her family’s rooms, she felt a snap in her mouth. Elation filled her as she realized the strap had broken. She wouldn’t lose this chance. Quickly, Ikki used her tongue to snatch at the bag, pulling it away from its owner as fast as possible. However, as fast as Ikki’s tongue could react, the equalist was apparently faster, grabbing the side of the bag and stubbornly chasing after it.

The spy could be felt moving towards Ikki’s throat, felt latching onto the pack with legs and arms, and a pang of worry shot through her. What if she accidentally swallowed her passenger? The thought scared the young airbender, and she realized that her pride was definitely not worth the life of some stranger. Ikki resolved that she would immediately stop and spit out both the spy and backpack, despite how close she was to her room. Ikki was beginning to slow as she rounded the corner when a sprinting Meelo surprised her, crashing headlong into her and sending them both sprawling to the floor.

Ikki’s greedy tongue fought against you, switching between pulling at the bag and pushing you away. Her head had whipped back as she had fallen further, eventually finding herself on her back and wondering how she had gotten there, her eyes gazing upwards towards the ceiling. However, even as Ikki was struggling to remain upright, Meelo was already bouncing back to his feet.

Hearing him give that as the reason for careening headlong into her gut only made Ikki angrier. However, before she could give Meelo a tongue lashing her brother darted off once more, leaving Ikki angry and feeling ill. Ikki smacked her lips and a familiar, foul taste became apparent, and suddenly Ikki realized that her spy was no longer held within her mouth.

Worry gnawed at Ikki as she cast her gaze about. Where was the spy? Had they escaped? A flash of guilt and horror flashed with her next thoughts. Were they injured? Were they dead? Ikki suddenly felt even sicker.

As Ikki continued to search for her missing charge as other possabilities started to form in her mind. What if Meelo had somehow stolen the spry amidst the chaos? Would Meelo hand him over to dad? How much trouble would she get into for having not only kept the equalist to satisfy her curiosity but mistreated him by hiding him within her mouth? Ikki was so upset it felt as if her stomach was doing back flips. Guilt and fear of the potential consequences warred within the girl as she released a small burp, distinctly tasting of vomit. She felt as if she were going to be ill.

After a few moments of searching fruitlessly, Ikki began to suspect the spy wasn’t nearby. Although that wasn’t a good thing, it also wasn’t entirely bad either. Whatever had happened to the little equalist probably hadn’t killed them outright; otherwise there would be a body nearby. An injured person might hobble away, but a dead person couldn’t. A bit of Ikki’s guilt began to subside as the realized she probably hadn’t killed her tiny charge.

However, nausea still clawed at Ikki despite her relief. The girl’s stomach refused to settle. She needed to calm herself before she continued her search.

Just as she had practiced during meditation, Ikki bowed her head and concentrated on breathing. Ikki’s body grew calm, her mind relaxed. She found herself in a tranquil state of mind, absent of guilt, hope, or fear. However, her stomach remained upset. A horrifying thought struck Ikki and tears filled here eyes at the possibility. Terrified to test whether or not her suspicion was correct, Ikki placed her hand against her stomach, praying that she was simply being paranoid.

Ikki’s hand settled against her belly, just below her navel. Nervously she waited, but thankfully nothing stirred. A small sigh of relief huffed its way between Ikki’s lips, only to turn into a startled yelp as a small form inside of her stomach pushed weakly against her hand. The tears which had been pooling within her eyes suddenly rushed down her cheeks as the true horror of what had happened finally began to hit her. She had found her prisoner.

1211311211211211.content:
With a groan and a pounding headache, consciousness began to slowly return. The dull rumble of voices could be heard, but your muddled mind could make no sense of what was said. Your head throbbed, your body ached, and your nose burned. A cloying heat tore at you, penetrating you to your core. Familiar darkness greeted your eyes as you reflexively opened them. At your next breath, the stench of vomit stung your nose and left you dizzy. The smell was so powerful that you couldn’t help but wonder if Ikki had puked.

What in the world had happened? One moment you had been clinging tightly to your pack, the next you had been bouncing around the inside of Ikki’s mouth. Even now you could feel bruises forming all over your body. Cautiously, you stretched you limbs, testing them as much as you could in the tight confines allowed you. Thankfully nothing seemed broken.

As you lay there a moment, you realized that Ikki was moving again. However, her movements felt weird. Instead of the gentle bobbing motion you had become accustomed to during your ride in Ikki’s mouth, a wobbling motion greeted you. This was odd. Loud, guttural groans could be heard intermittently, the sounds seeming to come from every direction at once. Gently, you probed outwards with your hand, trying to gauge where exactly in Ikki’s mouth you currently lay.

As you hands probed outward, a familiar sensation greeted your hand. You linen pack lay just within arm’s reach. You released a sigh of relief at the prospect. Continuing your investigations, you placed your hand against the wall against which you leaned. An unfamiliar surface greeted your palm, smooth and slimy with a distinct curve to it. You didn’t recognize which part of the mouth it may be so you decided to probe around until you found a tooth or something else familiar.

It didn’t take long for you to scout the confines of your prison. The same slimy, smooth flesh surrounded you on all sides with the exception of above and below. There, two fleshy mounds puckered outwards. The horrifying realization struck you that you were no longer in Ikki’s mouth as another groan erupted from all around you. A rude sound unexpectedly rumbled from above only to be followed a second later by the muddled sound of a belch. Another moment later the muscular walls around you started to press slowly inwards and you knew where you were.

Mindless panic took you then, sending you into a frenzy. You pushed and struggled, fighting off the muscular muscles of Ikki’s stomach. More groans emitted and you continued to fight, all the while the sway of Ikki’s movements continued to rock your putrid prison.

Amidst your struggles you realized that the air was growing thin. Your head was beginning to feel light and you could feel the beginnings of exhaustion. The walls around you were starting to secrete liquids, a trickle for now but in time you didn’t doubt you’d be soaked by the stuff. The acrid smell of acid was slowly growing stronger and you feared it wouldn’t be long now before the pain began.

A gurgling sound could be heard below as the orifice beneath you sputtered a little. The walls were still pressing inward, grinding against you and pressing your bag painfully against your leg, but it wasn’t too much for you to fend off. However, you were growing weak. Little enough air remained for you to breathe, and you were burning it all away with your vain struggles. Suddenly, a new pressure forced its way against you, this time from a single direction. You kicked out at the offending wall and a surprised yelp seemed to reverberate from above. Shortly thereafter the pressure receded.

Well at least the brat knew of your predicament, you thought with a grim satisfaction. As the air around you had lost its oxygen your limbs had lost their strength, gradually giving way until they were now pinned against your side. Your feet were forced together and our body was forced to curl up into the fetal position. A few air pockets remained, but the others had been forced either upwards to be burped out or downwards to pass through the digestive tract.

It wouldn’t be long now before you passed out. The stomach around you continued to contract, the pressure squeezing your ribs and making it difficult to expand your lungs. The air that remained to you wasn’t exactly fresh either, now more carbon dioxide and acid fumes than oxygen by now. A slow itch had begun to consume your body and you could feel liquid sloshing against your boots. Dark spots were dancing across your vision as you sat within the stomach. If Ikki was going to save you she’d have to do it soon.

As you sat within Ikki’s stomach, you could sense her movement. She was panicked, running somewhere as fast as she could. However, as a minute passed your vision began to go dim. A saddening realization struck you that Ikki probably didn’t know what to do. She had a person lodges in her stomach and was probably too scared to puke. As unconsciousness began to claim you, you felt a bit of pity for the poor girl.

She’d never be able to forgive herself, especially at such a tender age. However, before you fully fell into unconsciousness a rude noise erupted from above, followed shortly by a gust of fresh air. It was enough to rouse you. As the itching started to grow more intense, you wondered whether consciousness was such a good thing.

~~~~~~~~~~

It had been perhaps a minute since Ikki had found her captive’s location and there was now a distinct lack of struggles from within her gut. Although she had at first attempted to puke on the spot, she had found herself far too stressed. She had immediately changed tactics, heading towards the bathroom. She needed composure, but most importantly she needed water.

However, now as she finally reached the washroom she realized she’d overlooked an important question. Was there air in stomachs? The already panicked girl began to cry as her fragile composure began to crumble. “They’re going to suffocate,” Ikki cried in despair. Fat teardrops began to fall down her face once more at the thought of accidentally killing the spy.

Amidst Ikki’s tears, a thought suddenly took root. It was a simple thought, one which she should have thought of long before, but her addled wits hadn’t allowed. She could swallow air. If she did, the spy might last long enough for her to make herself puke. As she entered the bathroom and closed the door behind her she never paused, simply gulping air as she moved towards the water basin and turned the water on.

~~~~~~~~~~

Many more puffs of air had followed the first, shortly filling up the stomach and affording you more room. You used what little strength you had remaining to force your body upright, staying away from the slimy walls and their acidic secretions. Ikki was no longer moving as much, so you assumed she had reached wherever she had intended to go. The pool of acid at the bottom of the stomach had risen considerably, forcing you rise into a crouch as opposed to sitting.

You couldn’t help but see the irony in the situation, despite the painful burns which now coated your body. You, an equalist spy who opposed benders, were about to be eaten by one of their youths. It was laughable! What would your comrades think if they ever heard the story. You doubted they would find it nearly as humorous as you yourself did.

As the burning sensation continued, your endurance was about at its limit. Once more you found the air thin, yet now new puffs came to refresh it. You imagined the young girl must be at her limit, incapable of swallowing any more air. The pain of your burns was only growing worse as you crouched, too tired to fight your fate any longer.

This was it. The acid eating at your skin was simply going to kill you before Ikki could attempt a rescue. Resigned, you tilted your head upwards, mouthing a silent prayer amongst the bile, stench, and acid. “Please, don’t let my death haunt this girl.” A slurping noise erupted from above and cool, clean water belched downwards, filling your open mouth and rinsing the acid from your body. Water continued to belch forward, filling the chamber to the halfway point and expanding it even further than before. The cool water soothed your burns, reminding you that you weren’t dead yet.

~~~~~~~~~~

Ikki stood over a washbasin, having just downed her last cup of water. Her stomach groaned and ached from the water and the air, having stretched her stomach further than ever before. Cramps raged through gut and she could feel a pressure building at the base of her throat.

This was it! She was finally going to puke! Ikki dipped her head down as close to the sink as she could, preparing for what was to come. She had to get this right on the first try as she doubted the equalist had the time to wait on a second attempt.

Ikki pressed her fingers to the back of her throat while squeezing her stomach with her spare hand. She strained her stomach and hunched over. Silently, she prayed.

12113112112112111.content:
Sitting shoulder deep in acrid water, things were looking grim. The itching sensation had started once more as the stomach around you began to secrete more fluids to compensate for the water. As the air continued to be depleted, black dots had started to dance across your vision once more. You could sense death approaching, and you hadn’t the strength to fend them off. However, even as your mind continued to dull, something alerted you to a coming change, some sixth sense you couldn’t explain. The walls around you convulsed, squeezing inward and forcing the water level quickly above your head. Was this the end? Were you going to survive this long only to drown?

However, even as you thought those questions the pressure continued to increase. So great was the pressure that the air was forced from your lungs, putrid water forcing its way into your mouth. Instinctively you struggled, but it was weak and vain. Darkness began to claim your vision and the pitch black world around you slowly began to fade.

As you faded from consciousness, you became aware of a sudden drop in pressure. A sudden current was whisking you upward, lifting you upwards along with the rest of the stomach’s contents. The sound of retching now accompanied the symphony of gurgles you had grown accustomed to. Near the top of the chamber, you were forced into a narrow tube, barely fitting through the slimy opening. However, you still had no air to breath. Your consciousness continued to darken.

Dully, you were aware of a sudden cold bombarding your body. Light blazed behind your eyelids, yet you couldn’t bring yourself to stir. You felt your body splash down into a cool pool of water, only to be fished out a moment later. The outside world, it felt so nice, too bad it was too late. Unconsciousness claimed your mind and you knew no more.

~~~~~~~~~~

Ikki looked down at the equalist lying on the counter and couldn’t help but shiver in dread. Red, inflamed skin and hole riddled clothing greeted the girl’s eyes, causing her to cringe in horror. The spy had lost all hair, the acid having eaten it. Guilt once more wracked Ikki’s mind at what she had put this poor person through. However, everything would be alright now wouldn’t it? It had to be!

She had worked so hard, gone through so much. The equalist couldn’t die now. Except, there was no sign of movement from the form laid out before her. But she had felt movement within her belly just before she had begun to puke.
Ikki didn’t know what to do, but her hands seemed to move of their own accord. After a moment, she found her hand lightly pressing against the spy’s chest, a rhythmic pulse meant to force water out of a drowning victim. She had seen her father teach the very same method to the monks at the temple. A weak spark of hope blossomed within the young girl’s chest. Maybe she wasn’t too late after all.

~~~~~~~~~~

Amidst the darkness between life and death, you mind hung suspended, its fate yet undecided. In one direction you could sense life, but couldn’t remember why it was so important. In the other you sensed the spirit world, a promise of peace and rest. Your spirit felt tired, tired of living and tired of struggling. Death would be a relief. You began to make your way towards the other world.

However, before you had gone far, a painful pressure struck against your chest, forcing you towards life. Why? What force denied you your peace? Madly, your spirit flailed, fighting its way towards death and oblivion. However, the force was relentless. It pounded against your chest over and over, each time forcing you closer to life. No! You sensed a world of agony awaiting you.

No! You’d done your part! No one could claim otherwise. You begged and pleaded with the force, seeking oblivion over the agony that would surely await you, but the force paid you no head. You were close now, just one more push and…

You woke up, curling over on your side to heave up the water within your lungs. You coughed and sputtered, spilling an incredible amount of water onto the counter top before finally taking a gasp of air. The air was chilled and stank of vomit, but it was the sweetest thing you had ever tasted. You were alive. A surge of excitement at the prospect, and with it returned the full sensation of your tortured body.

Your throat was raw, your eyes burned, and your skin felt tender and inflamed. Your head felt cold, but you were too weak to lift your hand to investigate. As your eyes came into focus you looked up, seeing Ikki’s brilliant grey eyes fixed upon you. Tears glistened wetly upon her cheeks and even as you watched, a salty droplet splashed down beside you. Suddenly, you were shivering uncontrollably. You had survived, but you were terribly exhausted.

Tiredly, you shut your eyes once more, and this time sleep rose up to meet you instead of death. The last thing you remember before sleep claimed you was the warm sensation of hands clasping around your huddling form, their heated embrace a welcome sensation against the wet cold.

12113121.content:
Cautiously, you started out on your journey, immediately crossing the hallway and walking along the opposite wall. You strained your ears and eye as you walked, alert for anything which might signal an approaching resident, but no signs were forth coming. It was too damned quiet. There should at least be the occasional passerby, especially with your proximity to the main entrance. Something was up.

After about a minute of walking, your heart stopped. This was the moment you had been dreading most. When you walked down the side of the corridor, you had a much larger field of vision. You could see someone coming from afar and respond as needed. Turning a corner, however, robbed you of this advantage. You were blind to any danger that might be lurking just around the bend, though you would probably still be able to hear it. Regardless, it was a terrifying feeling.

After a moment of listening at the corner, you finally peeked around. An empty hallway greeted you. A sure of relief flooded through you, and you set off one more. As you walked, you thought once more over your choice of destination and the reasons behind that choice.

It had taken a while of deliberation, time which you hadn’t felt you truly had, but eventually one choice had stood out above the rest; the kitchen. Everyone had to eat eventually, so it was by far the busiest place in the temple. However, with activity came risk. Your chances of being discovered would be far greater with so many eyes about, but the prospect of such readily available information was just too attractive. Important conversations were commonly held in the kitchen, and anyone who visited the air temple would eventually turn up there. Furthermore, it had an ample supply of food incase your stores began to dwindle.

You were half way to the next bend when something caught your attention. At first you thought it was your imagination, so soft was the sound, but as it persisted you began to have your doubts. It was a strange noise, reminding you of the sound you get when you remove tape from a surface, but it was infinitely softer. As worry gnawed at your belly you stopped, taking a moment to look around.

As you stood your ground, ears strained for the slightest sound, you noticed something. The sound had stopped when you had. Worried that you might be the source of the noise, you took a moment to check, shuffling in place and walking in a circle, but the sound was nowhere to be heard. Your gear was securely in place and not a sound emanated from your person. A tinge of fear wound its way around your heart, and for a moment you considered turning back towards the safety of your hole, but what would that accomplish? Every moment wasted was another moment away from the safety of your next hideout, though you hadn’t found it yet. Still, the thought of safety was enough to get you moving again.

You continued your journey with a bit more care this time, traveling as quietly as possible and seeking out the noise, but the sound didn’t return. That was good. Perhaps you had been the source of the sound. You were definitely walking slower at the moment, and you hadn’t tried running when you had stopped earlier. You increased you pace for a moment, speeding up to a half jog for about ten seconds. After a short delay the noise returned, seeming even quieter than before yet still barely audible. You continued your little jog, seeking the source of the noise, but it wasn’t coming from your person. You stopped suddenly and the noise continued for a moment before suddenly stopping as well.

Panic was starting to build within your chest as you reasoned out the source of the noise. It started whenever you moved, but you weren’t the cause. Your immediately conclusion was that someone was following you, but a quick check behind you disproved that notion. Still, you imagined you felt eyes upon your back, burrowing into you as your panic mounted. The thought of some unknown being tailing you, invisible yet able to watch your progress, filled you with such primal fear that it couldn’t be ignored. After a second of thought, you tore off down the hall, running for your life and seeking out any shelter available.

Shortly after starting to run the sound returned, seeming more a pattering now as you raced along the hallways. The air rushed past your ears, filling them with a dull roar, yet now the sound could be heard over even that. You came to a corner and didn’t hesitate as you pushed ahead, escape the only thing on your mind. Ahead, a door frame was visible along the side of the hallway.

It was a storeroom no doubt. You had chosen this path specifically because it the least likely route for idle passers. It passed through the storerooms of the temple before eventually leading to the kitchens. The doorway ahead would undoubtedly have a crack beneath it through which you could escape. The room would hopefully be filled with boxes and crates amongst which to hide. However, even as you had thought of safety a dark shadow had overtaken you, darkening your world.

A great thud resounded from the wood behind you, knocking you off balance. You stumbled forward towards the doorway, the seam clearly visible from where you ran. You were so close, you were almost there, but it was not meant to be. A sticky hand wrapped around your torso, pinning your arms to your side before lifting you into the air. Your tiny body rushed into the air at a dizzying speed, and with equally dizzying speed you were turned around to face your captor. Your eyes were having difficulty focusing and nausea threatened to empty your stomach, but after a moment features began to come into focus.

Two light blue eyes and a gap-toothed smile filled your view, intimidating in both size and proximity. A stubby nose was nearly pressed against your chest and you could feel the air rushing through its nostrils. After a moment, the boy before you opened his mouth, releasing words which seemed to crack like thunder to your tiny ears.

“Got’cha!”

121131211.content:
After you recovered from the ear shattering boom that was the boy’s voice, you began to struggle against his grip. The boy might have caught you, but that didn’t mean you couldn’t break free. Twisting and turning, you fought the iron grip clutching at your torso. No, you couldn’t have failed your mission already! You hadn’t even been able to gather some useful information yet! You were only as tall as his palm, so his hand could easily encircle your entire body. However, it was apparent the boy didn’t wish to hurt you. You took advantage of that fact as you wrestled against the boy’s hand.

“Stop that!” the boy growled as you pushed your feet against his fingers. His grip was tight, but you still managed to make progress. You wriggled your back, trying to scoot to one side or another in order to slide out of the palm and away to freedom.

Hope blossomed as boy lost his grip on you, your struggles proving a bit much for the young boy. His hand opened and you began slip free, but as you looked down you suddenly had a change of heart. You hadn’t realized how far the drop would be! Even at the boy’s meager height, the drop seemed deadly. You clutched at a passing thumb in a vain attempt to arrest your fall.

Thankfully, the boy brought his second hand up, catching you before you began your decent towards death. This time, when he held you in his hand, you didn’t struggle. After seeing that you weren’t going to try to escape again he lessened his grip, affording you much more comfort but keeping both hands cupped around you.

As you sat in the boy’s hand, wondering about your fate, you decided to take a closer look at your new captor. A stubby nose greeted you first, flat and ugly. Slightly above, droopy eyes stared at you with boyish curiosity. A bald head caught you attention as it shined in the ambient light, momentarily blinding you. From the ridiculous smile gaping on his face, you gathered that he was missing a tooth. The stickiness of his fingers hinted at some sweet treat devoured not so long in the past.

You knew this face, though not by sight. It was the face of Meelo, Tenzin’s youngest bender brat. He had a reputation for rowdiness and rudeness as well as a distinct lack of personal boundaries. Judging by his current state, he probably had a lack of hygiene as well. You cursed you luck that of all the people you could have been captured by, it had to be him.

“Wow,” he said in voice thundered, though it was a normal tone of voice to the young boy. “You’re a tiny person.”

“Please, not so loud!” you shouted, which to him probably resembled a high pitch squeak.

“What?” he spoke normally, but seeing your hunched form and pained expression he seemed to get the gist of what you had said. He leaned in close now, and his next words came out in a hoarse whisper.

“Sorry about that.” Meelo paused for only a moment before charging ahead. “How did you get so small?”

Well, the boy wasn’t immediately suspicious. That was good. Maybe if you convinced him that you were a friend you might be able to get away. It was worth a shot, you had little left to lose. Setting your mind to the task, you began to spin your tale.

“I’m a…”

“How did you get here?” he interrupted, his attention caught by something else. A string of questions ensued, some of which you actually got to answer. Meelo was as rambunctious as the tales said and then some. Here in the abandoned part of the temple and without an adult to keep him in line, Meelo was a free to be his annoying, obnoxious self.

You felt a sudden burst of irritation. Children! You disliked them immensely. With their short memories and attention spans you just didn’t have the patience to tolerate their nonsense. As you continued to fume, however, you realized that Meelo had stopped talking and was now aiming a pointed glance at your bag. Irritation turned to a note of fear as you realized that there was an equalist insignia plastered right on the side of your bag, too late to hide the telling mark. You hoped for a moment that the boy wouldn’t recognize the symbol, but that hope died the moment you gazed into his light blue eyes. Suspicion stared back.

“You’re one of the bad guys!” He accused, a surprisingly intimidating glare radiating from such a childish face. Perhaps it was the size difference.

Dread resettled within your heart as you realized that you had little chance of escape now. The boy would likely bring you straight to his father, likely receiving a reward of sweets for his trouble. You would be taken into metal bender custody and questioned. You knew you wouldn’t talk, metal benders rarely tortured captives, and they wouldn’t be able to safely do so to someone your size. Although your secrets would remain safe, your mission was a failure. Realizing the inevitability of the situation, you sighed.

“Go ahead and take me to your father so we can get this over with.” Surprisingly, the boy obeyed. Meelo broke out into a trot, but just as suddenly stopped, unsure of himself. Once more he turned those dopy eyes upon you.

“Will you tell daddy what he wants to know?” Meelo asked. You hadn’t expected him to ask that question. Perhaps he wasn’t as dimwitted as he seemed.

“No. I'd sooner die than talk. Besides, it's not like your father will do anything to try to get the secrets out of me. Torture would be too risky to use on me anyways.” Your reply was simply truthful. It wasn’t clear what Tenzin would do to you once he discovered your presence, but you doubted you’d be hurt. Any torture they could inflict on you to pull information from you would most likely kill you outright at your size, so that would be a fool’s errand. Truthfully, the only knowledge of real import was the existence of a shrinking method for tiny spies, and that would be given away the moment you were seen. Still, you had a reputation as a loyal equalist to uphold.

“No.” Meelo’s voice was sharp. Shattering all preconceived notions of your fate.

“No?”

“No.”

“What do you mean no? That’s the way these things work. You take me to your father, he holds me for questioning, and I sit in a cell until Amon comes to free me.” As you spoke, uncertainty colored your voice. For a moment, you had forgotten that Meelo was a kid, and kids were prone to irrationality. Not even a minute ago you had been wishing for a way to avoid being brought to Tenzin, but suddenly Tenzin seemed a whole lot better than his irrational brat.

“Not until you agree to tell daddy what you know.”

Apparently Meelo was fiercely loyal to his father. You could understand where he came from, you were fiercely loyal to your cause after all. However, there was a problem. You were an adult, capable of making rational decisions for rational reasons. At present, you were being held by an irrational little boy who was fiercely loyal to his father and currently had you at his mercy. This could go bad quickly if you didn’t tell him what he wanted to hear.

“Ok, I’ll tell Tenzin whatever he wants to know. Just please, take me to him.”

You words were sincere. You would tell his father everything you knew the moment he asked, it was all outdated or apparent anyways. The only thing it would cost you was your pride, but the idea of a vengeful little boy roaming halls as you waited to be taken by the metal benders didn’t seem appealing. Although you would surely be watched the entire time, there was still the chance that Meelo might find the opportunity to take his vengeance if you were to lie to him. It would be best if you were a cooperative captive.

Meelo stared at you for a long time, reading your expression and thinking intently. His eyes bore into you, probing your face for deception. Was this really the face of a five year old? He seemed far more distrusting than would have been expected of one his age.

Even as Meelo's eyes bore into you, they hardened. Terror clutched at your gut as you knew the words to come before they had even been uttered; the words you had dreaded to hear most.

"You're lying."

12113121121.content:
Your outrage at the accusation was almost as strong as your worry. Staying with the unpredictable boy was becoming more and more stressful as one unexpected turn followed another. You had to convince the boy of your sincerity, no matter the cost.

“I’m not lying! What makes you think I’m lying?” Your voice was strained.

“You’re a bad guy. Bad guys always lie.”

Your heart nearly stopped at that last statement. How do you argue with that logic? Hell, would logic even work on someone as young as Meelo? What would the boy do to you if you failed to convince him of your sincerity?

Would the boy try to keep you, seeking to interrogate you started lying? Would he simply abuse you until you started confessing imaginary crimes? If he wasn’t willing to believe your words, how could you possibly convince him to take you to an adult?

“What can I do to convince you I’m telling the truth?” You feared whatever response you might be given. Meelo wasn’t rational, so it wouldn’t be surprising if his requirements were equally irrational.

“Tell me everything you know.” Once more, Meelo’s answer left you little to work with. How much would be enough? How could you convince the boy that you didn’t know more once you did finally tell him everything? Chances were good that you would have to lie to the boy in order to satisfy him. You weren’t a very good liar.

Fortunately for you, something unexpected happened. From somewhere deep within the temple, a voice called. Its warm tone was loving, yet carrying a great weight with it. You realized it must be the voice of Pema, the mother of the boy in whose grip you now rested.


“Meelo, it’s time to meditate with your father.”
Things had suddenly changed. With a burst of relief you realized Meelo wouldn’t be able to keep you for long. If he went to meditation, you would soon be discovered and confiscated by Tenzin. If he tried to hide you somewhere along the way to meditation, there was a good chance you could escape. Even then, if he took too long going to meditation, someone would come looking for him and rescue you in the process. You relaxed a little, secure in the knowledge that soon enough you would either be free or in more responsible hands.

The boy's mind was apparently following the same line of thought as your own, as his face was growing more and more worried. His grip tightened around you once more as he ran to the nearest store room, taking a hand away from you momentarily to open its door. Inside there were crates and boxes, but no suitable prisons. The next room yield similar results, and the third was completely filled with scrolls. The normal stride of the young water tribesmen was sure to shake you relentlessly, posing a serious danger if you happened to get stuck. However, no reward had ever seemed so worth the risk. It was with these thoughts in mind that you snuck from your hiding place and crept up to the side of the nearest boot.

The boot proved a little challenging to climb upon, its surface coming up to your shoulders, but the leather strap around its girth offered purchase. The surface reminded of you of felt, and tickled you as you climbed. Once upon the flatter surface of the top, you stood upright, feeling give beneath your feet. The climb up the leg would prove much more difficult.

Because of some quirk of the positioning of the boots, you were able to use the other boot to climb upward. You swung your body around the edge and, lifting your feet, wedged yourself between the two. Pushing hard and trying not to slip, you began to crab walk upward. It was slow going, and tiring, but shortly after starting you realized that you were committed. You wouldn’t be able to go back downward without either first going back to the top and dropping back down on the softer body of the shoe, or dropping downward onto wood.

The weight of your pack was like a boulder pulling you to your doom by the time you reached the fur, but by some miracle you made it. Your exhaustion was far greater than you had expected, and you had feared that you would suddenly lose your grip and tumble downward to the cold wood floor. Gripping the fur tightly, you allowed your legs to drop, smashing into the side of the boot. The grip afforded to you by the fur made it far easier to climb, but you were already weary. The rest of the climb ate at what little strength remained to you.

As you finally crawled upon the rim of the boot, you collapsed upon its soft, narrow surface. The extra layer of fur had made it just thick enough to lay on without dangling over the edge. You didn’t know what you would have done had it been otherwise. Wearily, you decided that a short, five minute break was necessary before you began to cut a hole in the lining. At least, those were your thought as you laid down your head and promptly fell asleep.

12132212111211.content:
A sharp rapping noise jolted you awake, causing you to panic and nearly fall over the edge. How long had you been out for?

“Korra, make sure you don’t fall asleep again like last time,” a high feminine voice called from the other side of the door. You were wondering whether it was Jinora or Ikki when the much deeper voice of the avatar echoed through the bathroom.

“Alright, I’ll be out in a minute.” The avatar’s voice reverberated against the walls, making her voice sound far louder than otherwise. A touch of embarrassment touched her voice. Truth be told, she had been snoring not too long ago, the heat having lulled her to sleep. The sound of sloshing water brought your gaze towards the tub.

As you turned your gaze towards the avatar, you were once more treated to the sight of her naked form. It was completely dark outside and the only source of light in the room was a half spent candle. In the half light, each water droplet shone with a golden radiance as it clung to her bronze skin. Her hair hung wetly about her shoulders and tiny streams of water flowed freely from her locks, wrapping her breasts in a watery embrace. Though her face was mostly cast in shadow, the angle of the candle fully illuminated her womanhood, its cream toned lips failing to hide the pink within. A thicket of black curls flanked the dripping crease.

Normally, genitals of either gender weren’t that interesting to you. You had been training for years to be a servant of the equalist movement, and any sort carnal pleasure had always paled in the face of duty. However, at your size and illuminated by the dull glow of candle light, the folds above you were impossible to avert your gaze from.

It was like watching a lion gallop past, both awesome and terrifying to behold. The water droplets in its mane shone with the golden brilliance of the fire beneath. It seemed to peek from between cover, watching you from above and waiting for the opportunity to pounce. You had little doubt that you would be engulfed, swallowed whole to waste away deep within its gullet.

Korra bent down to retrieve her wraps, obscuring your view and snapping you from your entrancement. You didn’t even remember seeing her step out of the tub. As she leaned down, her body obscured the candle, casting you in shadow and reminding you of where you were. Silently, you prayed as she reached her hand rushed past you in its quest for the strips of cloth she would wrap her pelvis in. Her wrist actually bumped the boot you were on.

You risked a glance upwards and were horrified; the avatar’s face filled your entire view. Dark as it was, you couldn’t make out details of her face. Only her eyes shone from that mask of shadows. You could feel her breath blow upon your body, moist and warm against your body. Silently, you prayed she would overlook you.
12132212111211.title: You Wake Up Before Korra Finds You (N)*

121322121112111.content:
Your prayers might have actually been heard, but more likely it was because of the poor lighting, but somehow Korra overlooked your miniature form. As she stood upright once more and began to wrap her pelvic region, the weak candle light once more reached you.

With a jolt, your mind began to race. What were you going to do? You hadn’t had time to cut your way into the boot’s lining, so you had no way to stowaway safely. You could jump and try to scurry your way back to cover, but the fall was very likely to injure you. The vast maw of the boot loomed beside you, offering a second option. It was possible that you could stowaway within the shoe. The drop wasn’t nearly as hard, especially if you were to cling to the sides as you fell. Suddenly, the image of Korra’s foot sliding into the boot and crushing you surged to the forefront of your mind, causing you to dismiss the idea entirely. You couldn’t’ spy on Tenzin or the avatar if you were dead.

Looking at the avatar, you realized that she had already put on her pants and was working to bind her breasts. You didn’t have much time. Quickly, you reached for your pack and started to crawl towards the edge. You only had one option, you had to jump and hope that the top of the boot was springy enough to cushion your fall. You had risen to a crouch and were posed to make your leap of faith when tragedy struck.

As the avatar reached towards the toilet to recover her shirt, it slid downward onto the boot. The woolen fabric crashed into you, once more plunging your world into darkness. You struggled in vain to leap off the edge of the boot and make your escape, but amidst the tangled fabric you were powerless to escape whatever fate had in store for you.

1213221211121111.content:
The blue fabric clutched at you, seeming black in its imposed darkness. You became disoriented amidst the tangles, trying to cling to the surface of the boot with all your might, but at your size you lacked the strength to resist. You bag caught the shirt, yanking you in a direction you no longer recognized. With a muffled yelp, you were tossed roughly off the edge of the boot, what lay beneath you yet unknown.

You smashed against the side of the boot as you fell, stealing some of you momentum and lessening the impact which soon followed. Soft worked leather, worn with long use, caught you as you smashed against the ground; all of the air rushing from your lungs. Black spots filled your vision as you struggled to regain your breath. Was anything broken?

Looking around, you realized that you didn’t have any time to check for injuries. Around you, near pitch darkness swallowed your gaze. The only source of light came from above, a circle of indirect candle light mostly blocked by the shadowy outline of the avatar fitting her shirt on. The reek of sweat and feet emanated from the soft, worn leather which surrounded you, having been absorbed by the boot after long and frequent use. You were currently resting within the heel of Korra’s boot, and any second a calloused foot would come smashing downward to quench your existence.

You searched around for a moment in search of your bag. Without your bag you were as doomed, as you would have no consistence source of food once within the avatar’s room save the meager rations contained within your bag’s burlap depths. With a quick sigh of relief your hand clasped around the handle of the bag just as your leather prison began to tilt, rising into the air at an alarming speed. Gazing upwards, you could just make out the avatar’s fingers dipping within the top of the boot, the thumb undoubtedly pinching the other side as she lifted the boot and sat down upon the toilet.
1213221211121111.title: You Fall Into the Boot (F)*

12132212111211111.content:
As Korra sat down the boot once more leveled out, offering you an opportunity to escape the certain death of Korra’s heel and flee towards the toe of the boot. Panic filled you as your hands clawed at the packed leather sole, struggling to rise. Fate had dealt you a bad hand, but you weren’t going to give up anytime soon. You could still hide and hope that your ride was a short one.

Blindly, you fled deeper within the shoe. You pushed your way beneath the low overhand, at first coming up to your forehead, but quickly dropping until you were forced to crawl. Once you reached the very front of the boot, you wedged your back against the toe as firmly as possible; your pack held firmly behind your head.

You made it just in time too. As you barely managed to secure yourself within the toe your entire world tilted. Where before you had been crammed into a small nook, you now found yourself at the top of a long drop. The small trickle of light which had filtered into the boot before was snuffed in accompaniment to the sound of rasping leather. Your world once more tilted, returning to its previous position as blunt protrusions bumped into you in the darkness. A sharp toenail gouged at you, smashing into your side and soliciting a yelp of pain. You’d feel that tomorrow, if you lived to see it.

As Korra sat, pulling on her remaining shoe, you were given a moment to take in your situation. In your current location, Korra’s toes weren’t pressed against you. This was good, as the less of an intrusion you posed the less likely she was to notice you. However, this posed a bit of a problem. Whereas you might have been able to anticipate any impacts if you were pressed against the young woman’s feet, in the dark and out of contact you would be pummeled unexpectedly. If struck at the wrong moment it might dislodge you, sending you onto or beneath the water tribeswoman’s foot.

Another thing you noticed was the smell. You hadn’t been given much time to take it in before, what with being afraid of being crushed to death and all, but now that you had a moment, you realized that the avatar’s boots really stunk. You had known she was a both a tomboy and very athletic, but by the way the stench clung to the boot you wouldn’t have doubted that she worked out in these things every day. It was enough to make you gag. The feet themselves weren’t so bad considering she had just spent a while soaking in the tub, but that didn’t mean they would stay that way. All you could do was pray that your journey was a short one.

You nearly lost your grip as the avatar started walking, your leather prison unexpectedly surging forward. The pit of your stomach roiled as you quickly rose and tilted, the calloused toes rising to smash you lightly against the boot, only to be smashed to the floor once more. You were given a moment’s pause to steady yourself as Korra stepped with her other foot before the whole cycle repeated itself.

Korra walked on for a while, every other step trying your strength as she padded through the abandoned hallways. Where was she heading? How far was her final destination? You would have loved nothing better than to know these answers, but only the dull thudding of toes against ribs answered you.

The avatar walked on, oblivious to fact that the fate of a person she had never knew existed literally lay at her feet. Every step brought you closer to losing your grip.

1213221211121111121.content:
Your arms cried out for relief and your ribs screamed in agony as you clung to the sides of the boot. Up and down the boot flung your miniscule form. Dizziness and nausea plagued you mind. You had only been riding for a few minutes, yet you knew the temple to take several minutes to traverse on most trips. Fear embedded itself as you realized that you weren’t going to hold. What was going to happen to you?

You thoughts scattered as Korra’s big toe scored a direct blow upon your abdomen. All of the air rushed from your lungs, robbing you of strength. Your already weakened grip slipped, and one of your hands tore free.

Terror flooded you as you hurriedly clawed at the side, seeking purchase once more. What would happen if you fell free? Would you get luck and slide on top of her foot, only to be felt and discovered? Would you be shaken to death and battered against her blunt toes, your broken unrecognizable once she finally discovered you? Or, would you be granted a mercifully quick death beneath the pounding flesh of her foot, reduced to nothing more than a stain beneath her calloused sole?

Korra’s foot slammed against the ground once more, whipping you hard into the toe. You quickly took advantage, resetting your body so as to maintain your grip. Korra’s foot lifted once more and her toes thankfully missed you this time. You couldn’t have taken two blows in a row. The pit of your stomach dropped as you were once more lifted into the air, silently praying for a short reprieve. You would get your wish.

The soft murmur of someone’s voice reached you within the stinking leather prison, far too muffled to be distinguishable. It sounded familiar, but they must have been too far away. However, Korra wasn’t too far away. Her voice reached you relatively un-muffled as she boomed her reply.

“Oh I was just heading back from a bath,” Korra’s reply was friendly. She knew this person. Footsteps could be felt through the leather around you as whoever it was approached.

“You didn’t fall asleep again did you?” Your savior’s voice was audible this time, although still garbled. Silently, you thanked them for the short reprieved.

“Oh come on, that’s just Ikki making up stories. You know better than to listen to her.” Even from the boot, Korra’s lie was obvious.

“Whatever you say.”

The conversation continued and you listened attentively, tending to your duties of a spy even in this situation. You managed to identify the other speaker as Asami Sato after a while, and gathered that she was on her way to the bathroom to take her own turn in the bath. Other little tidbits trickled into your ears as you law upon hardened leather, but most of it was useless. However, information wasn’t the most important thing at the moment.

You finally had a chance to rest. Even as you lay there, you could feel yourself start to slowly recover. Your strained arms were lax, and the painful burn which had been gradually building up began to recede. Hope began to return as your chances of surviving the trip increased with every restful second.
